120002.name: Devine tête
120002.description:
Players draw a card without looking it and put it on their headband.
They ask as many questions as possible in the limited time to guess the picture on the card: animal, vegetable, fruit, object?
By asking questions to other players they cannot answer with "yes","no" or" maybe".
For each card guessed, you eliminate a token.
The first player who gets rid of his tokens wins the game.

Similar to:

Amnesia
Am I a Banana?
Who am I?

120003.name: A New Hope (WEG 2nd Edition)
120003.description:
From the back cover

The Battle of Yavin marked the first dramatic triumph for the Rebel Alliance which set the crusade to restore the Republic on its path to ultimate victory. Join the grand quest to explore the locales and meet the people which had an impact on the outcome of that first important conflict!

Galaxy Guide 1 contains a definitive collection of backgrounds, statistics, and information on the heroes and villains from the original Star Wars movie, as well as a new adventure set on Tatooine suitable for new characters. This comprehensive guide to the Star Wars galaxy, featuring the art of Ralph McQuarrie, Michael Manley, and Al Williamson, and stills from the movie, details the aliens, Imperials, and Rebels that figured in those crucial weeks leading up to the Battle of Yavin.

120004.name: Yavin and Bespin (WEG 2nd Edition)
120004.description:
From the back cover

The galactic civil war between the Empire and Rebel Alliance has moved on from the isolated Yavin system, but adventure, new civilizations and great danger can still be found around the gas giant and it's moons. Find out why the Empire has quietly established a new base near the ruins of the first Death Star and brave the mighty storms of mighty Yavin itself in search of untold wealth. Slog through the icy tundra of Yavin 8 in search of a downed imperial spy or cut through the thick tangle of Yavin 4's jungles to explore the ancient Massasi temples which tower over the forest canopy.

Cloud City is a booming trade town located in a little-traveled pocket of space just off the Correlian Trade Spine. The Imperial annexation of the city is still two years away and life is still fast and good for the traders, tourists, business executives, gamblers and rogues who call Bespin home. Sample the decadent delights of Cloud City's pleasure palaces or cut shady deals in the dark and gritty world of Port Town. Gamble away all your belongings or, if you're good enough, you just might win rulership of the city for life! Move beyond Cloud City to brave the dreaded sky sharks that haunt the wilds of Bespin's skies or discover the secret of the planer Miser.

Yavin and Bespin are two of the most important systems in the Star Wars movie trilogy. This comprehensive volume details the creatures, aliens, cultures and geography of both planets. Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin provides newly-disclosed data that will fascinate movie fans and Star Wars game players alike.

120005.name: The Empire Strikes Back (WEG 2nd Edition)

rpgissuearticle.71552: Galaxy Guide 3 - The Empire strikes back

120005.description:
From the back cover

It is a dark time for the Rebellion...
The embattled Rebels are about to be driven from their headquarters on Hoth. Luke is about to take a significant but dangerous step forward in his exploration of the Force. And Han's sordid past is about to catch up with him.
Join historian Voren Na'al as he covers the locales and people that had such a decisive impact on the Battle of Hoth and its aftermath. Explore the frozen wastes of the ice planet and the teeming swamps of Dagobah, and delve into the hidden secrets of the asteroid belt and Bespin's Cloud City. Meet the nefarious Imperials, brave Rebels, and assorted bounty hunters and scoundrels who figured in those crucial weeks centered around the Imperial strike against the Alliance's secret headquarters.

Galaxy Guide 3 is the comprehensive guide to Episode V of the Star Wars saga, compiling information and facts from the movie, radio play, novels, and comics. You'll find within these pages a definitive collection of backgrounds, statistics, and information on the heroes and villains from The Empire Strikes Back, many of whom make their first appearance in a roleplaying supplement. Plus, join the adventure in an all-new scenario set in the luxury mining town of Cloud City.

120006.name: Alien Races (WEG 2nd Edition)
120006.description:
From the back cover:

Aliens! These oftime strange and unique beings fill the Star Wars saga with variety and excitement.
Fighting alongside aliens with the Rebel Alliance? Engaged with them in something the Empire considers less-than-legal activity? Need to know more about these aliens?

Alien Races provides the information you'll need on homeworlds, cultures, lifestyles and the behavior of over 30 alien species. Whether recognizable as bipeds, or insectoids with compound eyes, they make up a huge portion of the Galactic Empire.

120007.name: A Dozen Festivals and Holidays
120007.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new 8-page PDF, written by Michael Hammes, presents the DM with 12 holidays that can be dropped into almost any fantasy campaign.

120008.name: Return of the Jedi (WEG 2nd Edition)
120008.description:
from the back of the book

On the desert world of Tatooine, Han Solo, one of the heroes of Yavin, is encased in carbonite in Jabba the Hutt's palace. Yoda, the last of the great Jedi Masters, nears death. The fate of the Rebellion lies in the balance as the new Death Star battle station comes to completion. Luke Skywalker must confront his father, the Lord Darth Vader. So begins Return of the Jedi, the climax of the greatest space fantasy of all time.

Here you can find backgrounds, personality sketches, and anecdotes of the villains and heroes, humans and aliens, and monsters and droids appearing in Return of the Jedi. Game statistics for all of the characters are revised and updated for Second Edition. The book concludes with an adventure set on Endor just after the destruction on the second Death Star.

120009.name: A Dozen Free Divine Spell Components
120009.description:
From Introduction:

A Dozen Free Divine Spell Components is a free PDF that gives you a look at the concept behind Ronin Arts’ 101 Divine Spell Components. While 101 Divine Spell Components is not required to use this PDF it will greatly expand your spellcasting options.

120010.name: Marlin's Journey
120010.description:
The game is based on the film Finding Nemo, specifically scene in which the father tries to get Nemo back. Players play as Nemo’s father and need to collect the words “M A R L I N” in order. This is a print and play game.

In each round, a 6 sided dice is rolled to determine the movement of father. Then players should collect the words “M A R L I N” in order. The player hove to land exactly on the words, not pass through them. You can’t return the way. If you pass through jellyfish, you have to miss a turn. When you reach Nigel’s box, roll the dice to the goal. With odd numbers, you can finish. But with even numbers, you have to move to seagull box. The player that reaches Nemo first is the winner.

120011.name: Tramp Freighters (WEG 2nd Edition)
120011.description:
from the back cover

You're a free-trader ... answerable to no one ... hauling cargo for a tidy profit in your beloved ship, with your trusted comrades are your side ... free from all danger, from all "entanglements" - Imperial or otherwise ...

Sure, it's not all fun and games. There are Imperial Customs officials to outwit, space pirates to battle, loansharks, corrupt portmasters, mechanical failures and a thousand other things which make your life interesting.

And somehow you keep getting mixed up with that pesky Rebellion ...

Galaxy Guide 6: Tramp Freighters gives you information on Imperial regulations, ship modifications and the Minos Cluster, an area filled with opportunity for free-traders like yourself. You'll find everything you need to survive while making a handsome profit in the Star Wars universe.

120012.name: A Dozen Free Spellbooks
120012.description:
From Introduction:

A Dozen Free Spellbooks is a free booklet of spellbooks for use in any d20 fantasy campaign. This booklet presents 12 books (not just spellbooks) that can be introduced to a campaign as tre a sure, a book in a library, or possibly one available for sale in a shop.

120013.name: A Dozen Hazards of the Dragon's Lair
120013.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sequel to A Dozen Dungeon Hazards includes twelve new hazards specifically designed around those iconic fantasy monsters, dragons!

The hazards described in this PDF are:

Boiling Pools
Dragon's Breath (fog)
Dragoncorpse Trap
Fog, Acidic
Fog, Putrid
Lava Pool
Mushrooms, Draconic
Scarabs, Dragon
Slime, Draconic
Stone Egg
Treasure-Covered Floor
Vines, Dragontrap

120014.name: A Dozen Magical Rings
120014.description:
From publisher blurb:

Almost more than any other item in fairy tales and fantasy, the magic ring is a common treasure that bestows the hero with great powers. The twelve rings in this new PDF, from the armor ring to the viper strike ring, will help your character to become a great hero. Balanced and imaginative, the rings in this PDF continue the tradition of useful game material that Ronin Arts is known for.

120015.name: Devâstra
120015.description:
Publisher's Description:
Devâstra est un jeu de rôle tirant son inspiration de deux sources principales : l’Inde mythique et les manga de type shonen.
Dans ce livre, meneur de jeu et joueurs trouveront tout le nécessaire pour vivre et faire vivre de palpitantes aventures au sein de Prithivî :
• Les règles de création permettant de donner naissance à un Avatar et à sa Devâstra ;
• Le système de jeu et ses multiples options
• Une description exhaustive du monde : coutumes, vie quotidienne, religion, royaumes, factions, personnalités, etc.
• Les secrets qui restent dissimulés aux yeux des mortels
• Des conseils afin de s’approprier Devâstra au mieux et de lui donner toute sa saveur
• Un long scénario d’introduction pour faire découvrir le jeu et ses nombreuses possibilités

User Translation (by way of Google Translate):
Devâstra is an RPG drawing inspiration from two main sources: the mythical India and shonen manga style.
In this book, GM and players will find everything you need to live and to experience thrilling adventures in Prithivi:
• creation rules to give birth to an Avatar and his Devâstra;
• The game system and its multiple options
• A complete description of the world: customs, daily life, religion, realms, factions, personalities, etc..
• The secrets that remain hidden from mortal eyes
• Advice to take ownership Devâstra best and give it its full flavor
• A long introductory scenario to discover the game and its many

120016.name: Tears in Rain (Trollbabe)
120016.description:
From the introduction:
This is a Blade Runner hack for Trollbabe. You
need the original Trollbabe rules where you can
read about the basic game mechanics.

Tears in Rain is not a game
about re-enacting Blade Runner or repeating all
the cool stuff from the movie. That’s been done.
It’s about dealing with a situation, and exploring
that situation through your own Blade Runner
character. Feel free to invent new awesome
technology like the Voight-Kampff machine or
the Spinners, and give them new cool names
and functions. Help the humans. Or help the
Replicants. Or try to negotiate between them.
Fall in love. Have sex. Solve crimes.

120017.name: A Dozen More Dungeon Hazards
120017.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sequel to A Dozen Dungeon Hazards includes twelve new hazards to throw at your players the next time they expore a dungeon.

The hazards described in this PDF are:

Environmental and Terrain Hazards
Collapsing Chamber
Crumbling Stairs
Destroyed Floor
Steam Vent
Fogs, Fungi, Mold, and Slime
Door Moss
Doppleganger Mold
Draconic Fog
Harmonic Lichen
Hellish Fog
Pit Mushrooms
Planar Mushrooms
Spectral Slime

120018.name: A Dozen Planar Traits
120018.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 8-page PDF features a dozen planar traits that a GM can use to give a little more personality to the various planes and help distinguish one light gravity, normal time, finite shape, sentient, water dominant, neutral-aligned, wild magic plane from another. As such, these traits are designed to be added on top of, and used in conjunction with, those found within the SRD.

120019.name: A Dozen Trade Goods
120019.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 6-page PDF presents 12 goods that can be used as common trade items in any campaign. From a specific type of wood to special horses to dwarven rock salt there's a variety of items inside. Written by Michael Hammes, this PDF is designed for DMs interested in adding another layer of depth to any fantasy campaign world.

120020.name: XCOM: Enemy Unknown

videogamehonor.23090: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Game Graphics Nominee

120020.description:
Press Release

New York, NY - January 5, 2012 - 2K Games announced today that Firaxis Games, the creative team behind the iconic Sid Meier’s Civilization® franchise, is developing XCOM: Enemy Unknown, an action strategy title that is planned for release in fall 2012. XCOM: Enemy Unknown will be instantly recognizable to fans of the original X-COM, while breaking new ground in strategy games for today’s console and Windows PC gamers. With equal emphasis on deep strategy and intense tactical combat, XCOM: Enemy Unknown will place players in control of a secret paramilitary organization called XCOM. As the XCOM commander, players will defend against a terrifying global alien invasion by managing resources, advancing technologies, and overseeing combat strategies and individual unit tactics.

We’re looking forward to building upon the core gameplay experiences that fans of the original X-COM love, while introducing the franchise to a new generation, said Sarah Anderson, senior vice president of marketing for 2K. With Firaxis’ XCOM: Enemy Unknown and 2K Marin’s upcoming XCOM, 2K Games will be offering two different gameplay experiences drawing from the classic X-COM universe. Each game offers a unique XCOM experience in different genres, as envisioned by two different studios with unique creative visions.

Released in 1993, the original X-COM is widely regarded as one of the best games ever made and has now been re-imagined by the strategy experts at Firaxis Games. XCOM: Enemy Unknown will expand on that legacy with an entirely new invasion story, enemies and technologies to fight aliens and defend Earth. Players will control the fate of the human race through researching alien technologies, creating and managing a fully operational base, planning combat missions and controlling soldier movement in battle.

It’s been a dream of ours to recreate X-COM with our unique creative vision. We’re huge fans of the original game and it’s a once in a lifetime opportunity to re-envision a game that is as beloved as X-COM, said Steve Martin, president of Firaxis Games. We were careful to keep XCOM: Enemy Unknown true to the elements that made X-COM such a revered game while delivering an entirely new story and gameplay experience for both die-hard X-COM fans and newcomers to the franchise.

To learn more about XCOM: Enemy Unknown, gamers can pick up the latest issue of Game Informer Magazine, which currently has the worldwide exclusive cover story on the title. The story is rich with game details, including gameplay impressions, a first look at four of the alien enemy types, insight into combat strategies and tactics, the new base setup and more.

Players who wish to experience the original X-COM titles can do so by purchasing them on Steam. Please visit www.steampowered.com.

XCOM: Enemy Unknown will be available in fall 2012 for Games for Windows, Xbox 360® video game and entertainment system from Microsoft and PlayStation®3 computer entertainment system.

XCOM: Enemy Unknown is not yet rated by the ESRB. For more information, please visit www.xcom.com.

Source: The Developer Website.

120021.name: A Dozen Unusual Doors
120021.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeons are packed with corridor after corridor and room after room, all connected by a countless number of wooden, iron, stone, or otherwise normal doors. At times these doors are trapped, turning a dull encounter with a door into a potentially disastrous encounter.

The twelve doors that follow are not standard dungeon dressing pieces but neither are they traps waiting to be sprung. These unusual doors, manufactured by the dwarven craftsman Belkarath Mountaincrawler, are valuable treasures, each one custom-made for one of the dwarf’s clients. Belkarath Mountaincrawler, dead some eighty years now, made a name for himself as a builder of unusual architecture and furniture, many pieces of which are now in palaces, museums, or lost somewhere in the campaign world.

120022.name: Gnominia
120022.description:
Have you ever tried to manage a community of gnomes? This is quite a difficult task as they are hard to control and they usually do whatever they want.

Gnominia puts the players in charge of managing a village inhabited by gnomes and have them competing with other villages. The first player who manages to gain 20 trophies is declared winner.

A game for 1-4 players with a dynamic set-up which allows for ever-changing experiences, Gnominia is a dice interpretation of the deck-/pool-building concept made so popular by games such as Dominion or Ascension. Every player starts with an identical set-up for his village and can activate the various buildings using a set of three dice. During the game, various cards may be purchased to modify the village, allowing for different dice results. Players can also hire mercenaries, found guilds, upgrade their buildings, complete missions, and cast spells in order to gain trophies and win the game. All of this in frantic twenty-minute game...

120023.name: A Dozen War Trophies
120023.description:
From publisher blurb:

War, and conflict in general, plays a large part in most d20 fantasy campaigns. Whether it serves as a historical background for a world or is a part of an active campaign, war happens.

Now, a lot of things occur in war besides fighting, and one of those things is the collection of trophies of war. Everything from weapons to uniforms to personal possessions is taken by the victors from the defeated and brought back home, to be proudly displayed, hidden away in trunks, or even thrown away.

This 7-page PDF presents a dozen trophies of war to help GMs get their players started on the fun hobby of trophy collection. Although these items are designed with the idea of actual war in mind, they can be easily adapted to be gained as the result of a typical adventure.

120024.name: A Dozen Wilderness Hazards
120024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Continuing Ronin Arts' series of hazard-based PDFs, A Dozen Wilderness Hazards features 14 hazards encountered in the wilds. Use the hazards in this PDF to injure or kill the PCs or just use the hazards to slow them down. Includes a bonus tile from SkeletonKey Games' e-Adventure Tiles: Hazards -- Terror Stones.

120025.name: A Dozen Wooden Treasures
120025.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 7-page PDF presents skis, a wooden shield, an icon, and 9 other items manufactured of wood. The items in this PDF can be used to expand upon the equipment list in your fantasy campaign or as a source of unusual treasure items.

120026.name: AJR Battle
120026.description:
Promotional game by Flunch, a reastaurant chain in France.

It play like War in that you challenge each other in a turn and the most powerful card 'captures' the enemy card. There is a difference here in that a special die is also used. Every time you reveal a card, you roll a die and the value of the die rolled is added to the value on the card. So you can never be sure of a victory in any challenge.

The winner is the player who wins all the cards.

120027.name: Adventure Locations: Ice Tomb of the Dwarf Lord
120027.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this 14-page PDF is an adventure location that can be easily dropped into any standard fantasy campaign. Included inside this PDF is:

A map created using SkeletonKey Games' e-Adventure Tiles;
General map key waiting to be populated with monsters, treasure, traps, and hazards;
Two new monsters;
A new hazard;
A new trap;
Adventure hooks.




Also features a new bonus tile from SkeletonKey Games! In order to construct this map for use with miniatures you will need e-Adventure Tiles: Tomb of the Dwarf Lord and e-Adventure Tiles: Ice Caves. The bonus tile is a transition piece between these two sets.

120028.name: Snow Strike
120028.description:
Description from Box

KICK BUTT WITH AN F-14 - Intense dogfight action over Columbia

(The following is presented as a newspaper clipping)

Airstrike on South American Drug Bases.

Washington, D.C. - Pentagon sources today revealed that the elite 7th Air Wing will strike at South American drug operations. Fighter pilots will fly solo missions against the heavily defended fields, refineries and seagoing transport of the drug kingpins.

Mission Overview:


10 Different Missions. Strikes from carriers and airstrips to be launched against land and sea targets.



Specially Modified F-14's. Built for maximum combat control--barrel roll evasion, split-S close pursuit counterattack.



Pilots Who Bail Out. Pilots will control their chute and body angle to reach rescue zones.

120029.name: Words of the Wise

rpghonor.20196: 2012 ENnie for Best Free Product - Silver Winner

120029.description:
User Summary:

Words of the Wise is the Gen Con 2011 convention scenario written for the One Ring. The players aid the Woodmen and Radagast the Brown in their battle against Orcs.

120030.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 19 - Feb/Mar 1990)
120030.description: This issue contains an adventure for Talislanta "Underworld" and a fantasy RPG adventure "Into the Heart of Darkness"

120031.name: Jetstrike
120031.description:
Back of Box

Fasten your seatbelts and get ready to play JETSTRIKE - the number one flight action game from Rasputin.

Experience the Amazing 24 Bit Graphics

Use the Simple Control System

Attempt 200 Missions

Play Against 8 Different Opponents Using the Multi-Player Option

Choose from 60 Different Aircraft

Select your Weapons Systems from a Total of 60 Types Including a Tactical Nuke for Special Missions.

Altogether, one of the biggest games that you'll ever play on your computer!

JETSTRIKE - THE ONLY FLIGHT GAME THAT REALLY HITS HOME!

(Picture captions)

It is all down to you, Harry the mechanic and a selection of aircraft against the might of SPUDD (Society of Particularly Undesirable Dastardly Dudes) who have bribed the world's governments into allowing their dastardly acts go unpunished.

Select from 60 different and wide ranging aircraft including the MiG 29, F-22, F-117A, Fokker DR1, Spitfire, & the Zero to play out your missions - and you need the choice because there are over 150 to perform. You've got one life and seven different aircraft.

Enact dogfights, air rescue, reconnaissance and even secret agent drops. Take on the extra Aerolympics missions (20 of these) and the 10 training missions where the enemy fires blanks and a further 12 practice missions where the ammo is live.

120032.name: Der Kopf der Ainak
120032.description:
This is an universal adventure for fantasy RPGs.

The order of a trademan brings the adventures to a wonderfull south seas island. But which could be a beautifull holiday trip end in an adventure to safe the existence of a complete culture.

For easy integration this adventure contains tables for DSA, Midgard and AD&D

This is the 2nd adventure by DEM for the "Märchenwelt"

(user summary)

120033.description:
Kampen om Norge ("The Battle of Norway") is a strategy board game about the German invasion of Norway in 1940. Each player takes control of the armed forces of either Norway, The Allies, or Germany. Using plastic soldier playing pieces that represent armies, and cards that represent war ships, bombers, fighters and special actions, the players battle for control of the six victory cities on the board. Managing the resources you get from your playing cards is crucial to succeed.

The game is fast-paced and has a quick set-up, yet offers a wide range of strategic options and variations. The starting point of the game and the resources available to the different factions are based on the historical conditions, but the players have the chance to change the course of history. Kampen om Norge is suitable for 2–3 players (or teams) and is playable in 2–3 hours.


Den 9. april 1940 overfaller tyske stridskrefter et nøytralt og dårlig forberedt Norge. Felttoget i Norge er høyt spill, men Hitler har bestemt seg for å legge landet under jernhælen. Norske og allierte styrker mobiliserer og nekter å gi seg uten kamp. Klarer de å stanse det tyske stormløpet?

Dette er utgangspunktet for strategispillet Kampen om Norge, et spennende brettspill om den tyske invasjonen i 1940, som gir spillerne mulighet til å utøve historiekunnskap i praksis. Tidenes første norske strategi-krigsspill er lekkert utført med naturtro brikker, realistiske spillekort og et detaljert kart.

Hver spiller påtar seg rollen som øverstkommanderende for de militære styrkene til Norge, de allierte eller Tyskland. Ved hjelp av brikker, terninger og spillekort utkjemper spillerne en kamp seg imellom på brettet, der Norge og de allierte sammen må forsøke å stoppe Tysklands frammarsj på norsk jord og hindre at Tyskland okkuperer alle de viktige byene. Spillerne må ta strategiske valg, forvalte ressursene på spillekortene, flytte sine bataljoner omkring på spillebrettet og kjempe mot motstanderen om landområdene. Den som velger den smarteste strategien, har best sjanse til å vinne, men det hjelper også å være venn med terningene.

Kampen om Norge kan spilles i to vanskelighetsgrader.
120033.name: Kampen om Norge

120034.description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Belgium.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
120034.name: Les Aventuriers du rail en Belgique (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

120035.name: Das Jubiläum von Stetten
120035.description:
Das Jubiläum von Stetten is an german universal fantasy adventure in the series of "Geschichte aus Illîmas"

For easy integration in RPG systems this adventure contains data and tables for AD&D, DSA, MERS and Midgard

(user summary)

120036.name: Digi-World
120036.description:
From the creator's website:
Welcome to DIGI-WORLD, the only resource for pen and paper role-playing in the Digimon world setting. Taking elements from everything from Digimon Adventure to Digimon Frontier, we hope to bring you the definitive players guide. On this site you will find the rules for basic play, as well as world setting information for anyone unfamiliar with the Digital World. Initially this page is designed to mirror events from season 1 of Digimon Adventure, allowing only for your partner to evolve to Champion level, but regular updates will also be added. These take the form of sub-sites that will be linked from this main page, bringing you additional rules and scenarios such as Armor Digivolving, advanced monster lists and Spirit Evolutions.

The system in use is designed to make play as streamlined and simple for both the Game Master (GM) and the Players. For the purposes of play the enthuses is very much on the Digidestined, as children from all over the world are drawn from the safety of the real world and pulled into a world of adventure and excitement with their new Digimon partners.

120037.description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Alsace.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
120037.name: Alsace (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)

120038.name: Nachrichten aus Aventurien (1997)
120038.description:
This issue conatains news for the published books for DSA. It also includes errata, a puzzle and one charcter sheet.

(user summary)

120039.name: Fezzes are Cool!

rpgissuearticle.76405: Review: Loot 4 Less vol. 10: Fezzes Are Cool!

120039.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the tenth book in the Loot 4 Less line, in which we deal exclusively with items that have a cost to consumer of 2,500 gp or less. And to increase the level of difficulty in terms of providing you with low-cost items, we also don’t deal in one-shot (or even two- or three-shot) magic items.

Here in Volume 10: Fezzes Are Cool, we’re looking at a narrow range of wondrous items that you wear on your head, including crowns, hats, helmets, masks, caps, and turbans.

Many of these items are useful for spellcasters (in keeping with the origin of such items in myth and legend), but at least a few in each group can be useful to any character. Everything in these pages has no charges and can be used in adventure after adventure. Additionally, these items are all of real use. No spot-on-the-wall spells stored in a wand with a switch. We deal only in things that are of at least some practical use. No one is going to kill a teammate to make sure they get the fez of escape from the loot pile, but is that such a bad thing? These items can flesh out the equipment lists of low‑level characters, can be found in treasure troves of mid-range monsters, or can be passed out as party favors at the celebrations of 20th-level wizards.

120040.name: 4 Death Mage Feats
120040.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. While solid world-building is a useful skill, you don’t always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn’t have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that’s needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.


1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs each of which gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It may be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand-holding, and just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.


The High Concept: Four feats designed to augment the options and utility of death mages (from The Genius Guide to the Death Mage) or, if death mages aren’t being used in a campaign, that can be taken by alchemists of the reanimator archetype, clerics with the death or repose domains, oracles with the bones or dark tapestry mysteries, undead-bloodline sorcerers, necromancy-specialist wizards, witches with a death, occult, or plague patron and (if the GM wishes) summoners who have an eidolon with the undead appearance evolution (replacing death mage levels prerequisites with a class level prerequisite in the appropriate class).

The feats included are:


Deathless Vigor: Your studies into the power of death and undeath allows you to resist the call of the grave a little longer than most.
Revenant: When you die or are near death, spirits loyal to you form an undead body to carry out your bidding.
Student of the Dead: You can use the mystic lore found in corpses to alter your spells.
Vampiric Spell [Metamagic]: You can call forge a link between you and the targets of your spells, using it to gain false vitality.

120041.name: 9 Armiger Feats
120041.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. While solid world-building is a useful skill, you don’t always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn’t have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that’s needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.


1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs each of which gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It may be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand-holding, and just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.


The High Concept: Nine feats designed to augment the options and utility of armigers (from The Genius Guide to the Armiger) or, if armigers aren’t being used in a campaign, that can be taken by fighters (using their fighter class levels as armiger levels for prerequisites).

The feats included are:


Armored Hulk
Brace for Impact
Hard to Kill
Helmed Confidence
Push Back
Shield Crush
Shield Parry
Shrug It Off
Soak It Up

120042.name: Champion of the Great Rabbit-Race
120042.description:
Objective: be the first getting most winning points out of 4 races & learn more about your pet(s)
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die, move & draw action card;
if you support/feed your pet well it is speeding up, otherwise it will slow down/step backwards

remarks:
available with dogs, cats & rabbit meeples depending on edition
pocket edition 2-4 players
large edition (title changing to: Champion of the great dog/cat/rabit race) 2-7 players

120043.name: 5 Magic Witch's Daggers
120043.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. While solid world-building is a useful skill, you don't always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn't have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that's needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.


1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs each of which gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It may be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand-holding, and just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.


The High Concept: Introducing a new category of magic items; athames - magic daggers designed to aid witches (especially with their hex class ability).

120044.name: 7 Feats For Sword and Board Fighting
120044.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. Although solid world-building is a useful skill, you don’t always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn’t have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that’s needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.


1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs, and each one gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It might be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand holding—they just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.


The High Concept: Feats to make the otherwise fairly dull choice of fighting with a shield in one hand and a 1-handed weapon in the other more interesting.

The feats included in this PDF are:


Bashing Critical (Combat, Critical)
Knock Aside (Combat)
Guarded Attack (Combat)
Shield Check (Combat)
Shielded Maneuvers (Combat)
Shielded Rider (Combat)
Shielded Spellcasting (Combat)

120045.name: F-14 Tomcat
120045.description:
Back of Box

The Naval Fighter Weapons School Simulation

Will they call you "Deadeye" or "Tinkerbell"? Find out in the toughest fighter training ground in the world. You'll earn your wings as a Navy cadet and move up the ranks to pilot your own F-14 aboard the carrier USS Nimitz. Through two tours of duty over the deadliest skies today, you'll fight to attend the Naval Fighter Weapons School (nicknamed "Top Gun"). Match your skills against the top dogfighters in the Navy. Or jump right in and fly any of 80 randomly assigned missions.

(Photo captions)

Splash one bogey. Take out MIGs with your Sidewinder or Phoenix air-to-air missiles. It's up close your M61A1 Vulcan Cannon.

You don't know what a good chewing out is until you've ticked off Admiral Hawk. Wipe that smirk off your face, lieutenant.

Cool off, hot shot. A Russian Su-22 knocked you out of the sky and you're cold, wet, and humbled. If you're lucky, they'll let you fly again.

Take on the best pilots in one-on-one dogfights at the Naval Fighter Weapons School to find out who is the real top gun.

120046.name: Nautilus (Issue 14 - Dec/Jan 2001/02)
120046.description: This issue has its main focus on Lord of the Rings, it includes a complete hobbit village as setting for MERS (32 pages extra) which can be seperated from the issue.

120047.name: Jim Knopf's Abenteuerspiel
120047.description: For 38 years Jim Knopf, his friend Lukas the railway man, Emma the locomotive and all their friends have taken children to Lummerland. This game leads players to three different locations, Lummerland, Kummerland and Mandala, and of course the kidnapped princess LiSi must be freed. The game is based on the concept in Michael Endes stories of cooperation and the joint efforts against adversities. The die brings luck into the game and Emma suspension, because players need to be in the company of Emma when the pass the finish line, but Emma tends to run away to another player in the last moment.

120048.name: Combat Air Patrol
120048.description:
Back of Box

August 2, 1990

Saddam Hussein orders his troops onto Kuwait soil. The United Nations Security Council responds by roundly condemning the action. Allied forces mass on the border of Kuwait. The US Navy aircraft carrier Roosevelt lies in the Gulf within striking distance of all strategic targets. Its crew is on round the clock alert...

When the scramble siren sounds you begin to experience the mind numbing thrill of supersonic combat as you lead a formation of F/A-18 fighters deep into the heart of occupied territory. Plan your missions to the last second and launch synchronized attacks of devastating accuracy. Fail by a hairs breath and watch helplessly as your comrades crash and burn...

As a front line U.S. Navy fighter pilot you'll have more than your hands full in this unique combat simulator. With fight routes and targets taken from original Gulf War records, Combat Air Patrol has a heavy payload to deliver for serious flight sim fans everywhere!

Features include:


Pilot the F-14 Tomcat or F/A-18 Hornet fighters



Roar down valleys created by a unique contoured landscape system



Play in campaign missions, single missions and instant action modules



Explore over 11,000 km of road and rail networks, created from actual 'Desert Storm' pilot charts



Lock-on to 1000 different types of targets over a massive game world, including Scud missile sites, supply trucks, tanks and trains



Dogfight using your 'virtual cockpit' and keep your eyes on the enemy

120049.name: Monopoly: Euskirchen
120049.description: Monopoly set in Euskirchen in Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

videogame.136900: Twin Calibre: F29 Retaliator; The Heroes of the 357th

120050.name: F29 Retaliator

videogamecompilation.136900: Twin Calibre: F29 Retaliator; The Heroes of the 357th

120050.description:
F29 Retaliator is a combat flight simulator video game.

The game was developed during the final phase of the Cold War, based mostly on speculations on then-future machines of war that were expected to be in use in the year 2002, in particular the revolutionary aircraft design of the Lockheed F-22 (based on the game developers' guesstimate, which ended up looking nothing like the real-world Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor) and the Grumman "F-29" (based on the experimental Grumman X-29A).

The graphics were detailed by the standards of the period, featuring cities, bridges, roads, islands, mountains and moving vehicles. The plane's cockpit had three multi-function displays available to set up in a number of configurations. The fantastic "future" weapons to choose from include a fighter-carried Tomahawk cruise missile, rearward-firing AIM-9 Sidewinder air-to-air missiles and a gigantic cluster bomb.

The PC version allowed head-to head dogfighting using a null modem cable. This game is regarded as being severely buggy (for example, since the game allows the airplane to be controlled even after the pilot ejects, it is possible for players to hit themselves with their own plane).

The game includes four war scenarios: Arizona desert test and training site, Pacific conflict, Middle East conflict and the World War III in Europe. Each war scenario has several missions, with the total of 99 scenarios between them.

A "Special Mission" add-on was released with ZERO magazine in 1990, featuring a battle against the alien spacecraft from the then-upcoming space combat game EPIC.

Source: Wikipedia, "F29 Retaliator", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

The only flight simulation to provide 100 complex missions over four intense battle scenarios.

The only flight simulation to provide detailed daily war update reports.

The only flight simulation to present the latest in aerodynamic technology introducing ECOP cockpits, backwinder AAMS, supercruise, stealth, and more!

F-29 is that flight simulation.

F-29 Retaliator presents the fastest and most detailed graphical environment ever seen in a flight simulation. With multiple internal and external viewpoints, multi-player comms option and a wide range of difficulty levels, F-29 Retaliator will suit both the beginner and the expert pilot. You have the choice of two of the World's most advanced aircraft - the F-22 ATF and F-29.

120051.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 47 - Oct 2001)
120051.description: This issue contains the DSA adventure "Schatten und Licht" and an article about vampire in DSA.

120052.name: Dragonbane Rules and Information Website
120052.description:
User Summary:

All of the rules for the Dragonbane LARP, as well as specifications for the mechanical dragon that was created for it and other information, are available through the Dragonbane website.

120053.name: Allure of the Sea
120053.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 13-page PDF is a short D20 System adventure ready to be dropped into any fantasy campaign.

The daughter of a triton noble is being used as bait to lure unsuspecting people to their doom. The heroes must locate the lair of the evil seahag who is holding the triton lady and then free the triton from her captivity.

Includes maps by SkeletonKey Games.

120054.name: Ni Oui Ni Non: Nature
120054.description:
In Ni Oui Ni Non: Nature, players need to answer questions as quickly as possible – but without saying "yes" or "no". Can they do it? Yes or no? Um, I mean, is it possible or will they fail?

Each round, one player picks a question card — with questions for a child or adult depending on who she intends to confront — then she chooses a victim and starts peppering the player with questions. If the victim ever utters "yes" or "no" when answering, the first player to slap the bell advances her token on the game board. If the victim hesitates too long or answers only with the same vague responses, such as "I don't know", slap that bell! If the victim makes it through the questioning without uttering the forbidden words, however, then she advances on the track. The first player to reach the center of the game board wins.

Ni Oui Ni Non: Nature includes more than 900 questions about animals and nature.

120055.name: ni Oui ni Non: Géographie
120055.description:
900 questions about geography.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

Contents:

1 game board,
110 cards, including 55 for children (orange) and 55 adult (green),
1 bell,
6 characters.

120056.name: ni Oui ni Non: Autour du Monde
120056.description:
900 questions around the world (in English).

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

Contents:

1 game board,
110 cards, including 55 for children (orange) and 55 adult (green),
1 bell,
6 characters.

120057.name: ni Oui ni Non: Stars & Co
120057.description:
900 questions are divided into two groups (young and old), relate to the world of sports stars and showbiz.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

Contents:

1 game board,
110 cards, including 55 for children (orange) and 55 adult (green),
1 bell,
6 characters.

120058.name: Magic Items of the Senses
120058.description:
From publisher blurb:

12 magic items designed for use with the five senses in this first PDF of a new series. Athenaeum Arcane is Ronin Arts' latest series of magic and mundane items, spells and spellbooks, and DM aids designed for the D20 System. This 8-page PDF (one page devoted to the cover and 2/3 of a page devoted to the OGL) is presented in both a graphics-intensive version and a graphics-light version.

120059.name: Mallyate
120059.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is your character tired of never having the right tool for the right job? Maybe he?s stuck with a rapier against a gibbering mouther or wearing a cold resistance armor against a red dragon. Fear not! Mallyate is here to give a PC what he needs when he needs it for every combat situation.

This 6-page PDF introduces mallyate, an unusual special material that shifts form at its owner's mental command, the material reforming to create a weapon, armor, or shield perfectly suitable to its owner's current needs.

Mallyate is suitable for planar campaigns, high-magic settings, or adventures in which the player characters must constantly change their battle tactics and weapons to cope with a large number of different monsters with varying immunities.

So grab a chunk of mallyate, mentally shape it into a warhammer to deal with a skeletal menace and then instantly transform it into a greatsword to take down that vile necromancer. With mallyate your imagination is the only limit to the types of weapons and armors you can instantly create.

120060.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 49 - Apr 2002)
120060.description: This issue contains the DSA adventure "Die Hexe vom Dürluft" and the adventure "Der Zinnsoldat" for Midgard 1880

120061.name: Options for the Dead
120061.description:
From publisher blurb:

Athenaeum Arcane: Options for the Dead provides a DM with a variety of options for keeping dead player characters in the game. Including five templates, new feats, and rules for possession, Options for the Dead can be used as the basis for unusual adventures and encounters during your campaign.

120062.name: Substandard Magic Items
120062.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF takes the concept of scroll mishaps and applies it to magic items in general. Scroll mishaps occur when a user tries to cast a spell beyond his current ability (i.e. when his reach exceeds his grasp, although the opportunity is there for success). Substandard magic items come at this from the other direction -- competent spellcasters use shortcuts and inferior components to arrive at a cheaper, yet fallible, magic item. These casters have the ability to create a normal item yet they either cannot or choose not to.

This PDF includes rules for creating, using, and identifying substandard magic items. Whether you're in a rush the next time you craft a magic sword or the DM sneaks an inferior suit of magic armor into the next pile of treasure the rules in this PDF can lead to fun, sometimes disastrous results.

120063.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 50 - Jul 2002)
120063.description: This issue contains the shadowrun adventure "Im Kreuzfeuer"

120064.name: Fishtropolis - Word Fun for Everyone
120064.description:
User Summary

Fishtropolis is the sequel to the similar game Textropolis. You need to spell fish words to unlock new words and to gather fish. The game features over 2.500 hidden words and best of all, it defines them for you so you can axpand your vocabulary.

120065.name: FluOrama
120065.description:
"FLUORAMA! Prevent a worldwide outbreak by collecting all the bacteria in Dr. Zoistein's Laboratory!

OH NO! A group of bacteria has been spilled in the laboratory and threatens to spread. Play the role of Brandon, a Bacteria Specialist, and prevent a global disaster.

GAMEPLAY
- Place all the bacteria into the goal area to complete each stage .
- Use blocks to guide the bacteria to the goal.
- Upgrade items to help you on your path.
- All 120 stages are mind-testing puzzles, so find the quickest way to complete each stage.

FEATURES
- Unlock up to 5 different bacteria types
- Complete all 15 special missions
- Collect enough gold to upgrade helpful items
- Beat your highscore and share them with your friends online."

Source: The Game Website.

120066.name: iWarehouse
120066.description:
User Summary

iWarehouse is a transport puzzle game, your goal is to push the crates around in the warehouse to get them to the storage area, all with the least movements possible. As it is traditional with this kind of games you can only push one box at a time and you cannot pull any box.

This game features a D-Pad Controller to move your character.

120067.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 51 - Dec 2002)
120067.description: This issue contains the sience fiction adventure "Die TCS-Kadettentod"

120068.name: Wounds, Bruises, and Blood: A Rules Option
120068.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sure it's an easy matter to keep track of hit points. Sword stabs for 3 points of damage and character's hit point total is reduced by 3. Sword stabs again for 5 points of damage and hit point total is reduced by 5. And on and on until the character either is healed or reduced to 0 hit points. This is a perfectly acceptable system and one that needs to changes to work.

But let's say you're looking to run a "low fantasy, gritty, violent" game. Let's say you're looking for wounds that bleed.

Wounds, Bruises, and Blood presents an optional system in which not only is hit point damage tracked but each individual wound is tracked. That sword stab for 3 points of damage now has a chance of bleeding if it isn't properly cared for and, even if bandaged, there's a chance that the stress of combat will re-open the wound at a later time.

Additionally, under this system magic damage -- if uncared for -- continues to eat away at the target for hours after the attack and bludgeoning attacks can cause disfiguring bruises and potential loss of strength and flexibility to battered and broken bones.

And healing is no longer a "heal hit points and move on" process. Under this system, each wound heals separately -- a truly deep gash, for example, may require days or even weeks to heal.

With "Optional Options" scattered throughout this PDF, DMs can tweak and customize the system to suit their needs. Overall, though, the system is fast to use and adds only minimal record keeping to the game.

120069.name: Broken Bones: A Rules Supplement
120069.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you've already grabbed [Wounds, Bruises, and Blood], and you've started dishing out the serious damage. Nothing is cooler than watching your foes bleed to death after you thrust your sword into their chest.

Well, what would you say if you could grab a hammer and cave in their skulls?

That's what I thought you would say.

Broken Bones picks up where Wounds, Bruises, and Blood left off. With the rules in this PDF you can crush skulls, shatter rib cages, and snap limbs . . . all with the bludgeoning weapons you're already using! This system adds a little complexity to that found in Wounds, Bruises, and Blood but the overall record keeping and dice rolling involved remains relatively low for the reward of swinging your club into a foe's head and watching as he drops dead -- or dying -- from the hit.

As you've no doubt guessed, this PDF requires Wounds, Bruises, and Blood.

120070.name: 1942, The Pacific Air War Scenario
120070.description:
Box Blurb


300 new land-based missions



Includes head-to-head modem play



Philippines and New Guinea theaters



6 new US and Japanese aircraft types


Strap yourself into the cockpit of 1942 The Pacific Air War and you'll experience the ultimate simulation of daring air combat over the South Pacific. Chase down Wildcats, Corsairs and Zeros through relentless gunfire, harass enemy shipping with low-level, wave-skimming torpedo runs and perform gravity twisting dive-bomb attacks that will leave you glued to the back of your cockpit.

If you're already a 1942 The Pacific Air War fan, the Philippine Islands and New Guinea Scenario is exactly what you've been waiting for. Six new aircraft types, more than 300 land based missions, two new theaters in which to stretch your wings and, best of all, head-to-head modem play so you can dogfight with your buddies and really test your flying skills! This scenario will keep you airborne in adrenaline-pumping combat for hours!

120071.name: Campaign Planner Deluxe
120071.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 92-page PDF/book is packed with nothing but forms. Use the pages in the Campaign Planner to prepare your campaign world's cities, regions, towns, dungeons, people, religions, and more!

This PDF features the contents of all three fantasy Campaign Planners reorganized for your convenience.

120072.name: The Guild Companion (Feb 2012)

rpgissuearticle.74901: Balanced Profession Design based on Affinities

120072.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

120073.name: Changing the Rules
120073.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 13-page PDF presents players of the D20 System with rules changes intended to reconcile some key disparities in the D20 System. Focusing on environmental dangers and including information on hit points and combat, this new PDF goes a long way toward helping players of the game to bring a greater measure of realism to their campaigns.

120074.name: DreamCatcher
120074.description:
Publisher's Description:
Enter the surreal and fantastical land of dreams in this inventively surreal mini-RPG. Will you join with the noble DreamCatcher society to protect the sleeping minds of humanity, or will you snatch the ingenuity clean out of the heads of your fellow humans as a cunning Dream Thief? Will you create blissful dreams with the gentle, bird-like Anothen or plunge mortal minds into hideous nightmares with their opposites the wicked Katothen? Bring your past lives to mind, take control of the dream by sheer force of will and prepare for a wonderfully imaginative ride! Created initially for the Reversed Engineer competition (2006) in which it was a joint winner, this new updated version of the game has been revised and expanded. Perfect for use as it stands, or for inserting into other RPGs.

120075.name: Construct Mechanus
120075.description:
From publisher blurb:

Construct Mechanus introduces a new player character race, the mechanus. Inside this 24 page PDF you will find two different mechanus races, two classes, an assortment of feats, and a selection of firearms (using previously released OGC firearms rules).

This new supplement helps players and GMs to bring "steampunk" to their fantasy games. Construct Mechanus is the first in a series of supplements designed to create a non-standard world setting.

For campaigns looking to keep a more standard fantasy feel, Construct Mechanus allows the GM to construct the perfect villain(s) for use in planar adventures.

120076.name: DreamCatcher/Liquid Crystal (Back to Back)
120076.description:
Publisher's description:

This special printed edition brings together both competition pieces, DreamCatcher and Liquid Crystal, into a 60-page softcover book. These innovative and quirky role-playing games have been printed back-to-back with the indexes right at the centre for ease of reference. Just flip the whole book over to read the other title.

120077.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 53 - Nov 2003)
120077.description: This issue contains the adventure "Kur in Nebelquell" for the free RPG Thyria bei Nacht. It also contains an adventure for Cthulhu "Heimatliebe"

120078.name: A Dozen and Three Group Feats
120078.description:
From publisher blurb:

The feats in this 6-page PDF are designed with the tactics and needs of the adventuring party as a whole in mind. To a one, they are intended to for characters who wish to supplement their party member?s efforts in battle or seize the opportunities their fellow adventurers tactics open for them. A party with a strong backing in these feats will fight like a team, enabling them to overcome adversities that less cohesive parties would dare not face.

120079.name: Eternal Soldier
120079.description:
From the introduction:
You are holding a copy of the rules to Eternal Soldier. This is a set of rules suitable for fighting alien hordes on distant planets, vanquishing evil necromancers in dark castles, or winning the West. In this book you will find every battle since Cain slew Able. With this book, no adventure is farther away than your imagination.

120080.name: A Menagerie of Summoner Options
120080.description:
From publisher blurb:

The summoner, a spellcaster who conjures up animals or monsters to fight for him, is one of the most archetypal of magic wielders. Unfortunately, the rules governing summoning are somewhat limited, and summoners are largely bereft of unique flavor. In this 18-page PDF you will find a collection of new feats and abilities designed to increase the summoner?s role, and grant the archetype the unique flavor it deserves.

120081.name: Contacts
120081.description:
From publisher blurb:

This includes not only a dozen NPC contacts but also the contact rules from an existing open game content source. Three new feats, intended for use with the contact rules, are also included.

DMs and players can use these rules to add some roleplaying opportunities to their next game session.

120082.name: Core Class Variants
120082.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy Player's Companion: Core Class Variants presents over thirty variants on the eleven core classes found in the basic rules and three psionic classes. This 40-page PDF features the original open game content variants plus more!

Variants include:

Savage Champion: A super powerful barbarian hero.
Mystic Musician: An instrument-playing bard with a signature instrument.
Exorcist: An undead killer that sacrifices spellcasting for greater turning and undead destroying ability.
Keeper of the Seed: A druid charged with planting a magical seed and protecting the growth.
Possessed: A monk guided by the spirit of an ancestor.
Deformimancer: A sorcerer capable of increasing the power of his spells through self-mutilation.
Dragon Soul: A sorcerer variant bonded to the spirit of a dragon.

120083.name: Evokers: Weavers of Destruction
120083.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 8-page PDF is divided into two sections. The first introduces several new Evocation spells, all of mid to high level. These spells are designed to shore up the evocation school, and to give it more punch at higher levels of play. The second section introduces a handful of new specialist-evoker only feats, intended to boost the power of those who dedicate themselves to the harnessing, and unleashing of destructive spell energies.

120084.name: Fantastic Stunts
120084.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy Player's Companion: Fantastic Stunts introduces a new concept to D20 - Fantastic Stunts! By the expenditure of either Experience Points or an Action Point (complete Action Points rules included for those that do not already have the rules), your character can attempt the kind of cool moves often seen in action movies or TV shows, without having had to select a feat to allow him to do it. By default, any Fantastic Stunt can be tried if the character meets the prerequisites, though there are options to restrict this if desired.

120085.name: Fantasy Player's Companion: Feats 1
120085.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first PDF in a new series from Ronin Arts. Fantasy Player’s Companion, Feats 1 includes 30 different [General] feats that can be used in any D20 System fantasy campaign. These feats have been written with characters of several different levels in mind and are all intended to assist you in making your character unique and interesting.

120086.name: Fantasy Player's Companion: Hard to Kill (Feats 2)
120086.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hard to Kill is a collection of thirty new feats designed to provide players of both types of characters with ways to ensure the success of their characters. In addition to a handful of feats for adventurers of the first type, the bulk of the feats presented here are for the second type. Called “Survivor Feats,” these feats offer a wide range of new abilities to characters, but these abilities come at a price. To take a Survivor Feat, a character must have in his past suffered a setback of some sort, in some cases a very significant one. It is said “that which does not kill me makes me stronger” and that is certainly the basis for Survivor Feats – although being killed is in fact the prerequisite for several of these feats!

120087.name: Higher Level Feats
120087.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the most common complaints about the feat-heavy fighter class in particular, and warrior classes in general, is that there are too few feats specifically designed for high-level characters. While there are any number of expansive feat chains, most of these can be completed at lower-middle (for fighters) to middle levels (barbarians, rangers, monks, and paladins) of play, forcing the player to either choose sub-optimal feats for his character, or in the case of fighters specifically, to begin pursuing a second feat chain ? this latter choice, especially, can have the unfortunate result of diluting a character?s concept, so that a mounted, lance bearing knight also ends up becoming an archer extraordinaire, for example.

The new feats introduced here are intended primarily for higher level characters, and are designed to continue the progression of existing feat chains, to build upon the more powerful class abilities warrior characters possess, or add new abilities which high level warriors might find not only very useful, but widely applicable to warriors of all concepts.

120088.name: Priests and Paladins of Fire
120088.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this 11-page PDF you will find variant core classes and prestige classes written for followers of the gods of fire. The classes inside include:

Priest of Fire, a variant cleric;
Paladin of Fire, a variant paladin;
Champion of Fire, a 5-level prestige class;
Devotee of Fire, a 3-level prestige class;
Divine Agent, a 3-level prestige class




Also included are seven new feats for followers of fire.

120089.name: The Inner Eye
120089.description:
From publisher blurb:

Psychic Warriors and Soulknives haven't been very well supported, meaning that players of these classes have a very limited selection of useful feats. Patrick Younts solves that problem in this 7-page PDF of new feats for pyschic combatants.

120090.name: T'as Vu Ta Tête?
120090.description:
Similar to headband games but there are masks instead of headbands.

Put a mask on your head without looking at what it is and guess what animal You are.
Asks questions to other players to find if you're a cow, a monkey or another!
15 funny animals for children to have fun finding out who they are.

120091.name: Monopoly: Günzburg
120091.description: Monopoly set to Günzburg, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120092.name: Monopoly: Hagen
120092.description: Monopoly set to Hagen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120093.name: Monopoly: Neuss
120093.description: Monopoly set to Neuss, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120094.name: Monopoly: Siegen
120094.description: Monopoly set in Siegen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120095.name: Monopoly: Villingen-Schwenningen
120095.description: Monopoly set in Villingen-Schwenningen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120096.name: Monopoly: Straubing
120096.description: Monopoly set in Straubing, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120097.name: Monopoly: Solingen
120097.description: Monopoly set in Solingen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120098.name: Monopoly: Sindelfingen
120098.description: Monopoly set in Sindelfingen, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120099.name: Touch My Katamari
120099.description:
TOUCH, SQUEEZE AND ROLL
The latest installment in the Katamari series, Touch My Katamari, is the debut of the beloved franchise on PlayStation®Vita. The King of All Cosmos has a whole new bunch of weird and wonderful missions in store as you once again step into the shoes of his son, the prince. Use the PlayStation®Vita touch screen controls or dual analog sticks in conjunction with the rear touch pad to squeeze, stretch and roll your Katamari ball around the environments gathering up every possible object to make it grow. The King will send you to the four corners of the earth to complete your oddball missions and restore his very particular kind of Katamari order to the universe.

•Innovative Gameplay – Roll the Katamari in any direction using the multi-touch screen or dual analog sticks of the PSVitaTM, while for the first time ever the console’s rear touch pad lets you stretch or squeeze the Katamari to gather more objects at once or fit through a narrow space.

•Go Shopping – Collect candy and use them as money to buy items for the King, get extra music tracks and unlock new game modes.

•The King’s Bonus Mission – Playable once a day, replay one of the missions to get your hands on loads of extra candy.

•Membership System – Leaderboards rank players according to the amount of candy they earned in the previous three week period.

•“near” features – With the “near” virtual communication system for PSVitaTM, exchange information with other players and receive “Buddy Requests”. Try to beat other players’ top scores and earn extra candy!

Source: The Game Website.

120100.description:
Splink (SP + link) is a ball-stacking game that can be played with a Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and red).

RULES

2 players ('attractor' and 'repulsor') share a supply of 16 red and 16 white balls.

Splink has two types of game play:

- Duel: The players play two complete games, switching roles after the first game. Whoever gets the maximum score as the 'attractor' wins.

- Bid: Before the game starts, players take turns increasing bids as to how many ponts they think they can make playing the 'attractor' role. The player who passes first plays the 'repulsor'; the other player plays the 'attractor' and must get as many points as he bid to win.

The board starts empty. Starting with 'attractor', players take turns either:

a) placing TWO balls, one of each colour, on ANY TWO valid locations (empty spaces or 2x2 platforms) or...

b) removing a ball from the board that supports exactly ONE ball on the level above and placing a new one of the other colour from the supply onto the board on any valid location; even on top of the dropped balls. Notice that you can only do this action if there is at least one ball on the supply of a different colour of the ball that you want to remove.

GAME END

The game ends when the pyramid has been completed.

SCORING

To get the attractor's score, count the number of all different red-white visible connections on the pyramid (the 5 inner balls don't count for connections). A red ball and a white ball must be touching to consider it a connection.

VARIANT

Consider an unlimited supply for both colours.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
120100.name: Splink

Quoth the Raven (Issue 9)

120102.name: Frayed Knights: The Skull of S'makh-Daon
120102.description:
User Summary

Frayed Knights: The Skull of S'makh-Daon is a RPG of comedy and high fantasy, released by the indie company Rampant Games in 2011 for PC and 2012 for Mac. The game is a first-person party-driven dungeon crawler. The goal is to earn membership in the Adventurer's Guild.

120103.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 10 - 2006)
120103.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 10)

Contents:

Features
The Heart of Stone - From the Life of Alanik Ray By David "The Jester" Gibson
The Fraternity Unleashed - Members of the Ste. Ronges Cell By the Fraternity of Shadows
Perilous Pursuits - Fraternity of Shadows By Nathan "Dmitri" Okerlund & Jason "Javier" True

The Complete Misty Warrior - Adaptions of the Complete Warrior By Mark Graydon
Secrets and Sorcery - The Eye By Stephen "ScS" Sutton

Contributors

120104.name: Outlaw Racers
120104.description:
From the back of the box:

No Driving-Sim is quite like Outlaw Racers. For the first time you can race your car around city streets and highways without being confined to a specific route or track. Turn left or right at lights or burn straight through them, if you wish. But don't forget... the police may be hot on your tail...

120105.description:
User Summary:
Pirates & Diplomats is a mini-expansion for the game Navegador. It is included in the magazine Spielbox No. 1/2012. It consists of 6 cards (3 pirates and 3 diplomats). The Pirate cards allow you to rob goods from colonies if you have a ship in the sea region. With the Diplomat cards you can use the colonies and overseas trading stations of another player when you sell goods on the market.
120105.name: Navegador: Pirates & Diplomats

120106.name: Curse at Twilight: Thief of Souls
120106.description:
After being summoned to a mysterious manor, you must unravel the story of an ancient evil and discover your destiny before it’s too late in Curse at Twilight: Thief of Souls! Unlock memories from the past and solve intricate puzzles to break the webs of a curse. Explore a magical world beyond your imagination that has been waiting for you to save it. Experience Curse at Twilight: Thief of Souls, a stunning Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120107.name: Shattered Minds: Masquerade
120107.description:
Stop the villainous Visage from ruining Mardi Gras in Shattered Minds: Masquerade, an incredible Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game! Visage has unleashed a fog that has wiped away the faces of everyone in town. As Visage wreaks havoc on New Orleans, the Boudreaux family, who were thought to be long dead when their mansion burned down, has returned to take revenge on the town. Learn the dark secret of Visage and the Boudreaux family and stop them once and for all.

Source: The Publisher Website.

120108.name: Rebound Ramp It Up
120108.description:
Based on the classic action game Rebound, Rebound Ramp It Up adds a new dimension. The second half of the board is height adjustable, with pits at each scoring ledge. The scoring ledges are worth 100, 200, 300 or 400 points. At the top of the ramp is a bonus basket that is worth 600 points. Each player has three pucks to score with. The first player to reach 3000 points is the winner.

There are 3 game options:

High Point (for 2 players) - Players earn points by landing on the scoring ledges. Pucks that fall into the pits score zero points.

Slam Dunk (for 2 players) - Players only earn points by landing in the pits. Pucks not in a pit score zero points.

Solo Slinger (for 1 player) - The player tries to score 3000 points in the fewest number of rounds, using all six points. Pucks landing in a pit score zero points.

Re-implements:

Rebound

120109.name: Awakening: The Goblin Kingdom
120109.description:
After overcoming the Dreamless Castle and Moonfell Wood, you have come to the rugged, mountainous snow-peaked Goblin Kingdom. Princess Sophia, the only human seen in over a century in this part of the world, seeks answers from its wise King about the fate of the rest of her people. But dark portents await: things are not well in the Kingdom, and dark shadows lurk waiting to trap the unwitting Princess in Awakening: The Goblin Kingdom!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120110.name: Awakening: The Dreamless Castle
120110.description:
After Awakening in a mysterious castle it’s up to you to collect clues and valuable items needed to solve perplexing puzzles and escape! Listen to your fairy friend as she guides you towards the exit. Play fun minigames and solve clever locks to make it to the next room in the castle. Use your Hidden Object skills to search for the next hint and discover a young Princess’ destiny in Awakening: The Dreamless Castle.

Source: The Publisher Website.

120112.name: Awakening: Moonfell Wood
120112.description:
After awaking from a century long slumber, Princess Sophia finds a world that is devoid of people! Help her find her friends and family and take her rightful place. Search gorgeous locations for helpful clues and discover Sophia’s destiny in Awakening: Moonfell Wood, a beautiful Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. Follow your fairy friend as you explore the incredible landscape and help Sophia find her people!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120113.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 11 - 2006)
120113.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 11)

Contents:

Ravenloft
Report on Fihyrs - For the Eyes of the Fraternity By David Gibson aka Jester
Things that Go Bump - Shadow Fey, Boogeymen, and other Wee Beasties By Uri "Shadowking" Barak

120114.description:
Product Description
Some legends are born out of darkness. Drizzt Do'Urden grew up in the underground city of Menzoberranzan, home of the drow--a race of twisted, evil dark elves. However, Drizzt was unlike other drow. He fled the Underdark for the surface realm, where he befriended the human barbarian Wulfgar. Together they battled the most terrible threat ever to ravage Icewind Dale: the white dragon Icingdeath!

2008 marks the 20th anniversary of Drizzt, appearing in R.A. Salvatore's The Crystal Shard. This product kicks off the celebration for Drizzt, and contains:

3 figures: Drizzt Do'Urden (in new pose), Wulfgar, and Icingdeath the Gargantuan White Dragon -- in scale with other Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures Game collectable figures (prepainted, fully assembled, durable plastic).

1 fold-out, illustrated battle map.

5 full-color game stat cards, including epic stat cards for Drizzt Do'Urden and Wulfgar.

A booklet containing a scenario that rekindles the classic battle between Drizzt, Wulfgar,and Icingdeath, as well as an exclusive excerpt from R.A. Salvatore's newest Drizzt novel, The Orc King.
120114.name: D&D Icons: Legend of Drizzt Scenario Pack

120119.name: Beleman (Issue 1 - Jul 2004)
120119.description:
The issue contains mostly ingame / background stories about the region Thorwal, Angergast, Nostria, Albernia, Windhag - all made as local print. Very useable for GM to fill the adventures with life. The editor also gives tips and tricks and scebario ideas.

(user summary)

120120.description:
Introductory game for the English Civil War series by TCS Games, it is a small print & play wargame on this minor battle from the English Civil War, more a fighting retreat and a sequence of cavalry clashes than a complete battle.

The game features the now classic system from TCS, made of random chit draw leaders activation, based on the quality of the leader himself, that leads to units activation and subsequent movement and combat.
Each leader is rated from 1 to 3 (the higher the better, as he has more chance to be drawn earlier); when his chit is drawn from the pool, the player may move and have combat with all the units under his command. The activation is renewed for each other leader in the pool, except the last one that didn't move on that turn. there are no zone of controls (so movement is very fluid), terrain plays an important effect (as some terrain gives restriction to the attacker and improve the chances of the defender), combat is fast and furious (with advance, retreat and immediate elimination).

There are rules for melee, morale, cavalry charges, artillery and so on, with a very streamlined system that you may read and play in a few minutes.

Very good for introducing new players to the hobby, a sort of SPI quad games revisited and modernized
120120.name: Fairfax's Revenge: the battle of Langport 1645

120121.name: Wargame: European Escalation

videogamehonor.21139: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best 20th Century Era - Modern Computer Wargame Nominee

120121.description:
