Wargame: European Escalation is a real-time strategy game on PC, that maintains the two core values of the classic wargame (depth and reflection) while offering a dynamic, real-time gameplay, and an incredibly spectacular and realistic visual experience.

Set in the rarely explored Cold War period of 1975-1985, Wargame: European Escalation explores the battles 'that could have been' if history had taken the wrong turn at some point in the conflict. On both sides of the Iron Curtain that tears Germany in two, the two military alliances, NATO and the Warsaw Pact, are on the verge of war. The zeal of a patrol close to the East-german border eventually leads to a firefight with their enemy brothers. Soon the local skirmish pushes the already-tense relationship between NATO and the Warsaw Pact over the edge into all-out war.

Both superpowers have enough nuclear fire at their disposal to annihilate all life on the planet, but of course this is the very last resort; if an open conflict was to happen, it would take the form of conventional warfare in Germany, and throughout Europe.

The world is about to fall into the feared 3rd World War. Wargame: European Escalation plunges you into the midst of this conflict, through a big and explosive military campaign!

Source: The Game Website.

120122.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops – Rezurrection
120122.description:
Lift off into the latest Zombies epic with "Rezurrection," the new downloadable content pack for "Call of Duty: Black Ops," and the first to launch players into space for a new dimension of undead action!

Old school Zombie strategies get blown out of the airlock in "Moon," where armed with new perks and a space-age arsenal of weapons, our heroes must overcome undead astronauts and fluctuating gravity as they unearth conspiracies that began in 1943.

Rounding out Rezurrection are the 4 maps that spawned the Zombie phenomenon: "Nacht der Üntoten," "Verrückt," "Shi No Numa" and "Der Riese."

The Rezurrection content pack includes:

• The all new Moon level
• Four re-mastered levels of Zombie lore: Nacht der Untoten, Verruckt, Shi No Numa and Der Riese, the Zombie factory that started it all
• An enhanced Zombies Soundtrack including, three tracks never before available for purchase
• A new Zombies Moon theme

For our fans that purchased the Black Ops Hardened or Prestige Editions, the entire Rezurrection content pack will be free, including Moon, the four re-mastered maps, the soundtrack and the theme, by simply re-downloading their Classic Zombies Pack.

Source: The Developer Website.

120123.name: Halo: Reach – Anniversary Map Pack
120123.description:
User summary:

Seven multiplayer maps from the Halo history have been remade in high definition for Halo: Reach. Six classic multiplayer maps along with a new Firefight mission. The Anniversary Map Pack also includes seven new achievements.

120124.name: Halo: Reach – Defiant Map Pack
120124.description:
User Summary:

Defiant Map Pack brings three new maps to Halo: Reach. Two are new multiplayer maps and one a Firefight mission. Also included are 3 new achievements and 150 gamerscore.

120125.name: Halo: Reach – Noble Map Pack
120125.description:
The fight for humanity continues on a galactic scale. From a frozen xeno-archaeology site harboring secrets centuries old to an orbital anchor defending the stars high above planet Reach to mysterious places far, far beyond, the Noble Map Pack injects three new explosive environments into the multiplayer battlefield, each designed to reinforce all of Halo: Reach's vital warfronts, from small scale engagements to massive Invasion battlegrounds.

Source: The Developer Website.

120126.name: Halo 3 Mythic Map Pack
120126.description:
Made from Space Age polymers, the Mythic Map Pack comes with not one, not two, but three new multiplayer arenas, including the Forger’s paradise, Sandbox.

Source: The Developer Website.

120127.name: Halo 3 Legendary Map Pack
120127.description:
A blend of old and new that brings a crumbling Ghost Town, an icy Avalanche, and Blackout into the Halo 3 mix.

Source: The Developer Website.

120128.name: Halo 3 Cold Storage Map
120128.description:
User Summary:

A classic Halo: Combat Evolved map, updated for Halo 3 online play.

120129.name: Halo 3 Heroic Map Pack
120129.description:
Shoot it out on Standoff, take Rat’s Nest for a spin, and Forge your metal masterpiece inside of Foundry’s abandoned warehouse.

Source: The Developer Website.

120130.name: Halo 3 Mythic Map Pack II
120130.description:
The final Halo 3 multiplayer maps – Heretic, Citadel, and Longshore – make their long awaited standalone debut.

Heretic returns players to familiar ground, Halo 2’s Midship, Citadel forces small squads to stay in constant communication, and Longshore’s multitude of industrial buildings, elevated walks, and open inlets conspire to create a complex battleground tailored for multiple combat scenarios.

Source: The Developer Website.

120131.description:
Sacramentum Gladiatorum is a game recreating gladiatorial combat in the arena in ancient Rome.

Turns are played simultaneously by players. In the first step, they will plan the move or the action for each gladiator. In the second step, they will reveal their orders and apply the results.

Combats are also planned using counters to determine where the gladiator will hit his opponent and how he will protect himself.

The location of hits is then reported to the part of the body chosen and general vitality of the gladiator will decrease.
120131.name: Sacramentum Gladiatorum

120132.name: Battlefield 3: Back to Karkand
120132.description:
Includes four maps brought over from Battlefield 2, 10 new weapons, 4 new vehicles, 5 new achievements/trophies, and a new addition to the series, "Assignments". The maps from the expansion pack will be: Strike at Karkand, Gulf of Oman, Wake Island, and Sharqi Peninsula.

Source: Wikipedia, "Back to Karkand", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120133.name: Fist Fight Club: The Dice Game
120133.description:
Fist Fight Club – The Dice Game (FFC) is a custom dice game for some fast and furious fist fight action with your mates.

Designed to be a fast play game, FFC is perfect for filling those times when other games are just too long (you know, like when your at your games club and have ten minutes to kill with your mates, or when you're waiting for a train).

How does it play? Well, here is the abridged version for two player games:

Players have 6 custom dice each, these dice have attack and defence icons on. They roll the dice to build up a 'fighting hand' with which to fight each other. Of the 6 dice, 3 are on show to all, three are kept secret.

The attacking players attack by playing one of their dice that shows an attack value. The defending player must play a die that shows the correct defense value to counter the attack value played on them. The attacker then plays a die with an attack value that counters the defense die just played by the defender.

This continues until one player is unable to play a die. If the defender can't play a die, they take a point of damage.

For games of more than 2 players, the actions gets even more intense as players attack who they want with the winner being the player with the least amount of damage taken when the first player to take all their damage is knocked out. So, attacking the player with the most damage isn't always the best tactic!

Capable of filling just as little as 5 minutes for two players but capable of being a big as you want. The more players you add, the more fun it is.

Being compact, it's easy to always having FFC with you. This means you and your mates never end up sitting around with nothing to do at your local club/store as you wait for your opponents to turn up. Just get out your dice and throw down with some mates for some real ‘underground fight club’ action as a warm up for your main event!

120134.name: Anduin (Issue 61 - Jun 2001)
120134.description:
This issue contains the DSA adventure "Insel der 1.000 Schlangen" and the 7th sea adventure "Abschaum der Menschheit"

This is the first pdf issue of the Anduin, it is free for download.

120135.name: Reise durch Nord- und Mitteldeutschland
120135.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game;
each player throws the die moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instuctions of rule sheet.
Remarks:
game has two seperate boards which show north & middle region of W-Germany
printed ~ mid. 1950's

120137.name: Menacer 6-Game Cartridge
120137.description:
The Menacer 6-game cartridge was the title Sega bundled with the Menacer for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis. As the name suggests, the cartridge contains six games that require the Menacer to play. Comparable to Wii Play, the games mostly aid the player in the process of learning how to use the controller.

All games were conceptualized by Mac Senour, the producer for both the hardware and the software.

Frontline : A rail shooter where players engage in combat with enemy vehicles in the desert (probably a reference to Operation Desert Storm).

Pest control! : A shooting game where players defend a pizza from insects while in the dark.

Ready, Aim, Tomatoes! , tomato shooter with ToeJam and Earl in which players assume the role of ToeJam who is shooting tomatoes at many of the enemies from ToeJam and Earl, including boogeymen, mad dentists, and even a batallion of chickens who use a tomato cannon.

Rockman's Zone: another rail shooter which players shoot at cutouts of criminals while trying to avoid shooting cutouts of innocent civilians.

Space Station Defender: a sci-fi shooter where players fight against extraterrestrial aliens which appear in pods. This game is notable for allowing players to select whether they want to play the game using a fixed pattern or a pattern where the aliens appear randomly.

Whackball! : The only game in the Menacer 6-game cartridge where shooting is not involved. Instead, the player uses the menacer as a mouse to strike a ball in an attempt to change the color of the tiles before time runs out.

Source: Wikipedia, "Menacer 6-game cartridge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120138.name: Custom Robo (N64)
120138.description:
Custom Robo (カスタム ロボ Kasutamu Robo?) is a robot fighting game. It was released in 1999 for the Nintendo 64 only in Japan, and in 2006 for the iQue Player only in China. It is the first title of the Custom Robo series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Custom Robo (Nintendo 64)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120139.name: JAWS: The Card Sharking Game
120139.description:
The first ever game that actually plays out the Hunt for the Great White from JAWS (1975)! Out of the only handful of games made about JAWS since 1975, none of them have been about or represented the events from the first Jaws film.

1-3 players play the Orca ship deck, 1 player plays the JAWS deck. The Orca deck wants to run the JAWS deck out of cards with various weapons, flotation barrels, a shark proof cage, strychnine, etc. During the hunt the Orca players can be expected to drink, sing, fish, work together and back stab each other. The time of day can change as the hunt progresses as well as the Orca's distance from shore.

The JAWS deck wants to eat the Orca crew, consisting of Quint (Robert Shaw), Hooper (Richard Dreyfuss), and Brody (Roy Scheider)! No better way to do this then by sinking the Orca first! Each deck has its own unique way of winning.

Everything that happens during the last hour of JAWS (1975) is in this game. Everything!

120140.name: Stronghold Legends
120140.description:
Stronghold Legends is a castle-based real-time strategy game by Firefly Studios. It follows in the series of Stronghold and Stronghold 2. Unlike the previous Stronghold titles, Legends gives the player a choice of different starting rulers with different troop types (including King Arthur and his knights of the round table, Count Vlad Dracul, and Siegfried of Xanten). Other new features include cooperative multiplayer against computer-controlled opponents and the choice between different gameplay options for online play (Death-match, King of the Hill, Economic War, and Capture the Flag).

Source: Wikipedia, "Stronghold Legends", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120141.name: Sea Change
120141.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Emerald City Knights is a complete Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition adventure set in Emerald City, Freedom City's west-coast counterpart. This downloadable product includes a PDF of Chapter 4 along with Hero Lab files for 14 non-player characters.

This chapter picks up where Chapter 3 – Power Play left off, but you can also run it as a stand-alone adventure.

120142.name: Petit Folimots: Animaux
120142.description:
Little Folimots - Animals.

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.

120143.name: Petit Folimots: Le Corps Humain et les Vêtements
120143.description:
Little Folimots - The Human Body and Clothing

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.

120144.description:
Little Folimots - Fruits, Vegetables and Food.

Quickly finds the letters forming the word and press the buzzer to win the card. The first to win 10 cards wins.

Little FOLIMOTS can be used as a expansion of Folimots with 80 new cards.
120144.name: Petit Folimots: Les Fruits, Legumes et Aliments

120146.name: Bliv Borgmester i Mariagerfjord
120146.description:
From the website:

"The game's objective is to become mayor and keep the post of mayor, which obviously gives certain advantages during the game. This is done by collecting votes throughout the game.

Besides the mayor title, it is also to acquire the city's businesses and create jobs for the city. This allows power and affects on each player's ability to gather votes. Money means a lot in the game, but is certainly not the decisive element. It's about playing the game tactically and be part of an alliance at the right time. The player can sit on power at one moment and sit with almost nothing the next minute. It is therefore important to constantly be alert and keep up with what opponents are doing. 2-6 participants. From approx. 9 years. Younger children may have practical roles. The game duration is about 100 min..."

Commercial Concept: The concept of Bormesterspillet is very simple. The city's enterprises and businesses buy advertising space on the local board. The prices for advertising slots vary by size.

Source: [www.borgmesterspil.dk The Game Website].

120147.name: Birth Signs
120147.description:
From publisher blurb:

In many fantasy stories the protagonist was born during a special astrological event. The sign the character was born under sometimes grants the character special bonuses, inspires grave prophecies, or influences the story in any number of other ways. This short release in the Forbidden Arcana series presents the players and DM with a system for introducing the concept of birth signs to their D20 System games.

120148.name: YerTurn!
120148.description: In YerTurn! each player, one at a time, draws a 'create' card and attempts to mold the object featured on the card with modeling dough. Other players attempt to guess the object the creator is molding. The player who guessed the object and the player who created the object will advance on the board. Special 'turn' cards are drawn when a player lands on a YerTurn! space; these cards include actions (double up, smash, lose a turn, etc) for use immediately or to save for later. Play consists of moving through the spaces on the board and being first to the final space!

120149.name: Eater of the Arcane
120149.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ability to consume the power of magic items and convert that energy into special powers is the domain of those known as eaters of the arcane. Eaters of the arcane are a rare breed and few of them survive once they descend down the path of magic dependence.

While not evil, eaters of the arcane are most definitely not good. These spellcasters, surviving off of power drained from magic items, are substance abusers of the worst possible kind. Few eaters of the arcane manage to shake their addiction and those who do carry the scars of their former addiction for life.

120150.name: Burning Spellbooks
120150.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 12-page PDF is packed with 27 different tables that assist a GM in determining what special effects occur when a spellbook is burned.

Characters within the sphere of a burning spellbook's effects may he helped or harmed by the event. 162 entries ensure a wide range of surprising effects no matter what type of spellbook is burned.

120151.name: Kelust's Tower
120151.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 28-page landscape PDF presents a six story wizard's tower complete with a sampling of books, spells, magical and mundane treasures, and notes on using the tower and wizard in your campaign.

What you will not find is a detailed write-up of the wizard or involved and constructing plot notes. This tower is intended for creative DMs looking for a source of wisdom, new magic, and a place for player characters to go to learn and relax.

The tower is mapped out using tiles from SkeletonKey Games' popular e-Adventure Tiles series. Tile sets used in this PDF include Wizard's Tower and Round Tower. While those PDF sets are not necessary they will prove useful if you find yourself using Kelust's Tower as the site of a combat encounter.

2 of the 28 pages in this PDF are devoted to a new e-Adventure Tile (one page in color, the other in B&W).

120152.name: Lost Spells
120152.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release covers the results of disrupted spells, the tables within this PDF present a wide range of events that befall bards, clerics, druids, paladins, rangers, sorcerers, and wizards.

120153.name: Magical Diseases
120153.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forbidden Arcana: Magical Diseases presents 21 new magical diseases, a new prestige class, and seven spells.

120154.name: Magical Foods
120154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Michael Hammes, author of Forbidden Arcana: Lost Spells and An Evening's Entertainment brings us a 12-page PDF packed with rules for crafting magical food. From feats to spells to magic items this short PDF includes everything you'll need to start creating magical foods that challenge and delight.

120155.name: Magical Pipes and Tobacco
120155.description:
From publisher blurb:

This latest release in the Forbidden Arcana line, written by Michael Hammes, is a 13-page PDF devoted to new rules for magical pipes and tobaccos. Including new spells, this Forbidden Arcana release is another fabulous addition to this popular line of inexpensive PDFs.

120156.name: Necromantic Feats
120156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromantic feats are gained and used in the same way as those in the Player’s Handbook. They differ only in that their power comes from the character’s control of negative energy rather than from some innate ability of the character himself, and that there are possible (even probable) side effects to contend with.

Only wizards specializing in necromancy (or one of a necromancer
core or prestige class) may choose to take a necromantic feat rather than one listed in the Player’s Handbook and then only if they meet the listed prerequisites of each feat.

120157.name: Performance Magic
120157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Michael Hammes, author of Forbidden Arcana: Lost Spells, An Evening's Entertainment, and Forbidden Arcana: Potion Mixology presents a new PDF that focuses on bards, sorcerers, and wizards and the art of performance magic.

From discussions on exactly what performance magic is to new spells, new magic items, and tips on using already-existing spells in performances, this 14-page PDF is loaded with a lot of great content for the performing mage or bard.

120158.name: Potion Mixology
120158.description:
From publisher blurb:

Michael Hammes, author of Forbidden Arcana: Lost Spells and An Evening's Entertainment brings us a 12-page PDF covering rules for mixing potions to create new, unique effects.

Packed with nothing but new rules and "crunch," this PDF reintroduces an old rules idea to the newest edition of the world's best-selling fantasy RPG.

120159.name: Spelltouched Feats
120159.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forbidden Arcana: Spelltouched Feats, 12-pages long, is written by Michael Hammes and illustrated by Christopher Shy. Featuring 25 spelltouched feats (inspired by a previously-existing OGC product), this release follows the Forbidden Arcana practice of expanding magic within the D20 System.

120160.name: Wizards' Spellbooks
120160.description:
From publisher blurb:

This latest release, written by Michael Hammes (Forbidden Arcana: Spelltouched Feats, Forbidden Arcana: Lost Spells), features three spellbooks and some information about the wizards who use them.

With 10 new spells, 4 new magic items, and enough ideas to inspire a trio of adventures, Forbidden Arcana: Wizards' Spellbooks continues the popular Forbidden Arcana series of PDFs with all of the quality and creativeness that Ronin Arts is known for.

120161.name: Hot Shots Golf: World Invitational

videogamehonor.31303: 2012 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

120161.description:
Golf With Your Friends!

The over-the-top golf franchise is back using a wide array of PS Vita system features including front and rear touch for shot preparation, 3G asynchronous gameplay, online tournaments, and the ability to look around the course in real time. Golf has never been so deep on a handheld system.


Source: The Game Website.

120162.name: Wer gewinnt den Ozeanflug Europa: Amerika
120162.description:
Objective: be the first team (2 players) reaching target space (30) with a matching number
- Roll & Move' game with spinner/moving by turn -
each player spins a number to form/join a team
2 - 4 players must take off in USA, 5 - 8 in Europe
best number gets the Zeppelin (starting from space 11)
spin and move according the number - ending on an even-numbered space follow instructions: see cover inside

remarks:
published early/mid 1930's in Germany
very large map: 47 x 67 cm / 18.5 x 26.4 inches

120163.name: The Stronghold Collection
120163.description:
User Summary

A compilation including the first five games in the Stronghold series.

120164.name: Champions Super-Characters
120164.description:
From the game:

These are the super-powered heroes (and foes) for your CHAMPIONS adventures. Lightrune, Brute, Flying Cobra, Lorelei, Hellspawn . . . 37 imaginative figures. One of them will be perfect for YOUR character!

120165.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 18 - 1988)
120165.description:
This issue contains three special fantasy adventures in the self- created world Krakh-Khas:


Der Zauberstab des Quolman!
Hilfe rettet mein Spion!
Der Tierhändler und das liebe Vieh!

120166.name: Monopoly: Bamberg
120166.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bamberg, in Germany.

120167.name: Monopoly: Bochum
120167.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bochum, in Germany.

120168.name: Monopoly: Bodensee
120168.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bodensee, in Germany.

120169.name: Monopoly: Aschaffenburg
120169.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Aschaffenburg, in Germany.

120170.name: Kirby: Nightmare in Dreamland

videogameversion.153087: North American Game Boy Advance edition

120170.description:
From Back of Box:

Everyone in Dreamland has lost the ability to dream! It seems that King Dedede has stolen the Star Rod, the source of power for the Fountain of Dreams, and given its fragmented pieces to his goons for safekeeping. The world needs a hero...a round pink one. As Kirby embarks on an adventure to recover the star rod, he'll have to copy every trick in the book to bring good dreams back to dreamland.

120171.name: Diablo II: Gold Edition
120171.description:
User Summary

A compilation including Diablo II and the expansion.

120173.name: Syne Strat 7
120173.description:
French abstract strategy game for 2-4 players.

A chess/ draughts type game played on a board of hexagonal spaces, where the aim is to ‘secure’ the central group in order to place one of your towers there, or to capture all of the enemy towers. Securing the central group can be achieved by Majority or Totality.

If aiming for a ‘Majority’:

With two players you must occupy 5 of the 6 hexes in the central group.
With three players you must occupy 4 of them.
With four player you must occupy 3 of them




If aiming for ‘Totality’:
You must occupy at least one hex of the central group with the rest being completely empty of opposing pawns.

To win by either of the above methods the player must place
one of his towers in the central hex, which takes ‘a turn’. Victory can also be achieved by capturing all of the opposing towers thereby leaving you opponent without a tower to place in the central blank hex.

120174.name: The Game of LIFE: zAPPed Edition
120174.description:
As in the Original Game of Life, the goal of the game is to collect the most money by the time you retire at the end. The difference is that this new version of the Game of LIFE uses an iPad combined with a traditional gameboard. The free app brings your game to life as you move around the board. You still get to move your car from space to space and select your path to retirement, but now you spin, get paid, sue other players and make important decisions all on your iPad. While some spaces have traditional actions, if you land on app spaces, you unlock more than 100 clips from America’s Funniest Home Video. Find out if these videos bring you good fortune or bad luck.

This game requires the LIFE ZappED iPad application.

120175.name: Fire and Movement
120175.description:
Tactical Second World War game simulating a British battalion attacking a reduced German battalion in 1943-45. Published in the book Simulating War. Components are also available from the author's website. The designer recommends playing with seven players in two teams.

The game is played on a 6x8 hex grid, each hex representing about 150 meters across. Units are platoons, divided into four British companies versus two smaller German companies. The British side also has a machinegun platoon. Both sides are supported by off-map mortars. Terrain tiles are randomly placed before play to make a unique map for each game.

Players take turn moving and firing with all their units. There are limits on cooperation between units from different companies. Successful fire attacks pin enemy units, preventing them from firing or moving during their next turn.

Victory is decided by elimination of enemy units. The British player also scores points for moving units to the opposite board edge.

120176.name: Moon Drop
120176.description:
User Summary

In Moon Drop, your goal is to safely pilot the space pods so the lunar colonist can survive. Each wave of pods is larger so you need to control their flight paths skillfully and quickly. If you manage to do a perfect land you will get a bonus.

120177.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Forbidden secrets and dark rituals alter the face of reality in Lost Rites, the fourth Asylum Pack in the "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. As the game’s different factions race to discover, learn, and master forgotten rituals, players gain two new conspiracies that grant new control over the struggles they will face during the game's story phase.

Lost Rites immerses players in the mythos of Lovecraft's eerie fiction, enriching the game's synergies between dark Tomes and the daring Relic Hunters who seek them. Scientists, cultists, and monsters scour the libraries and haunted woods for powerful Tomes and the arcane knowledge they contain. Will the magical forces they unleash hasten the end of days? Or will heroic government agents and Miskatonic University faculty be able to force the Ancient Ones back toward their eternal slumber in distant realms?
120177.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Lost Rites

40270.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10579: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

120178.name: Final Haven Core Rulebook

rpgitemversion.153102: lulu EPUB for Adobe Digital Editions

120178.description:
Publisher's Description:
Final Haven is a flourishing open source LARP which was developed, tested, and currently operates out of the Midwestern United States. The Final Haven world is a post-apocalyptic medieval fantasy realm which blends the intrigue, ingenuity, and diverse backgrounds of its players to solve physical and mental challenges. We believe that teamwork, combat, puzzle solving, and of course a sense of humor, blend to form an exciting and dynamic environment for players and GMs alike. Character Creation is easy and the rules system has been simplified greatly from many other LARP experiences to help new players integrate quickly. Additionally, many of our players find that the rapid early advancement system in our game helps them become quickly involved in the long-term story arcs, and in the political aspects of the game.

120179.name: SafeKracka
120179.description:
"SafeKracka is a complex psychological puzzle that will test your ability to get into other people's minds

You have a series of 30 safes to crack. That's a lot of combinations. But you know the owner of each safe, and you understand that people choose a number with personal significance as a basis for the combination, like a birth date, a special event, or even an old army serial number. All you have to do is read their minds!

Some combinations will come easily, others may take days of careful research. But difficulty is rewarded and you can progress from Punk to Grand Master SafeKracka, by checking your ability against all other players worldwide.

Features:
No time limit - this may take you months.
Beautifully rendered safe artwork - historic, contemporary and futuristic.
Play the game in any order - just swipe left or right for another safe.
Easy-to use-rolling combination interface - just flick with your finger
Opened safes reveal their secret and are automatically saved.
'Guest Mode' allows you to reset the game temporarily so a friend can test their skill.
Compare your ability by direct link to an online score database."

Source: The Game Website.

120180.name: Final Haven: Heroes and Villains Expansion

rpgitemversion.153106: lulu EPUB for Adobe Digital Editions

120180.description:
Publisher's Description:
The Final Haven: Heroes and Villains Expansion was created to address some of the chief complaints about the core rules, primarily an inherent lack of versatility between character builds and a lack of mechanical character advancement past the twentieth level. The goal was to address these problems without increasing the power level of the game. The rules that follow are meant to be used in conjunction with the core Final Haven rules and not as a stand alone game.

120181.name: Star Wings
120181.description:
User Summary

Star Wings is an arcade game in which you take control of a spaceship. You will face many challenges steering your ship, asteroids, black holes, mines, enemies and other physics based elements. Your goal is to survive all the space hazards in 36 different missions.

120182.name: Devine Tête: Célébrités
120182.description:
Devine tête version with celebrities.
Players draw a card without looking it and put it on their headband.
They ask as many questions as possible in the limited time to guess the celebrity on their card.
By asking questions to other players they cannot answer with "yes","no" or" maybe".
For each card guessed, you eliminate a token.
The first player who gets rid of his tokens wins the game.

120183.name: Firestarter
120183.description:
From the introduction:
"Firestarter" is a role-playing game set within the shadows of the Soviet Union's paranormal
research. Psychokinesis (PK) and demons ("dragons") are real and amuck. You
might play a scientist, a psychic, a skeptic outsider, a Russian mobster, a KGB agent,
an American agent, a corporate mercenary, half-demon prince, or some surprising combination!
You might not even know yourself. Think KGB X-Files meets Hellraiser noir.
A Firestarter game session requires a Game Master (GM), players, and a dice pool (of
your favorite sidedness). Firestarter sprung to life as a last-minute entry for the November
2005 Ronnies competition. This is my first attempt to design a role-playing game
and it is admittedly incomplete. I chose to include the keywords DRAGON and SOVIET
and exclude GUN and MUD.

120184.name: Flame of Edrith
120184.description:
Creator's Description:
Flame of Edrith: a fantasy role-playing system adaptable to almost any fantasy setting. A complete and comprehensive system, Flame of Edrith uses simple and quick mechanics for in-game activities such as combat to ensure smooth game play, whilst backing these up with more complex and wide-ranging rules governing facets of character development including guilds, experience, business and land ownership, military service, potion making and much much more. Flame of Edrith features:


Seven fully playable races.
Twenty-one distinct character professions.
A mana-based magic system centred around gemstones, including over three hundred unique spells, prayers and rituals.
A detailed bestiary with almost one hundred and fifty creatures.
A straight-forward and easy to use combat system.
Rules governing everything from rune-smithing to running an illegal business; from holding government office to language acquisition.

120185.name: Flashback
120185.description:
From the introduction:
FLASHBACK is a game about identity and the power of choice. The Players assume the roles of characters (PCs) that awaken in a strange place, with no memory of their former lives. As the game progresses, Players receive Flashbacks which represent the slow trickle of memory returning to the character. Although the cards indicate the content of the memories, it’s up to the individual Player to decide its specifics. Does the memory of committing a crime make one a criminal or is it the choices made from here that matter most?

120186.name: Michael Phelps: Push the Limit
120186.description:
Get inspired by one of the greatest athletes of all time.

For the first time ever, Michael Phelps: Push the Limit brings the fun, fitness and excitement of head to head swimming to your Kinect. With innovative, motion-controlled gameplay technology, you can turn your living room into a king-sized pool - big enough for the whole family or a bunch of friends!

Splash into a casual fun match-ups against friends and family, or dive deeper and immerse yourself in the world of competitive swimming in career mode, and climb through the ranks for a chance to take on the greatest athlete in the world: Michael Phelps, himself.

Source: The Game Website.

120187.name: So What's The Human Called, Anyway?
120187.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So your PCs have wandered into a nearby town. Perhaps they are relaxing in the tavern talking with the locals, haggling with a merchant or trying to gather information about a nearby ruin from a sage. Then they ask “so what’s this bloke called, anyway?” At this point, the GM normally uses the first name that pops into his head (probably “Bob,” or the one he used minutes ago for another NPC) crushing the players’ suspension of disbelief.

So What’s The Human Called, Anyway? banishes this problems by providing 500 first names and 250 surnames and nicknames of Anglo-Saxon, Finnish, Greek, Roman and Viking origin. Divided by culture, these handy tables enables the busy GM to generate literally thousands of unique names for use in his campaign. Players can also use the tables herein to create cool names for their PCs that suit the background and flavour of their GM’s campaign.

120188.name: Random Marsh Encounters
120188.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Got barely enough time to prepare the module? Want to include cool, evocative random encounters in your games, but just don’t have the time to prepare them? Bored of pointless random encounters comprising bands of generic monsters that only seem to exist to attack wandering PCs? Then Random Marsh Encounters is for you!

Presenting eight ready-to-use random encounters ranging in EL from 2-8 (and 16 stat blocks ranging from CR 1/2-8) all suitable for use in any marshland or swamp, Random Marsh Encounters takes the pressure off the time-crunched GM, enabling him to concentrate on crafting cool, evocative adventures!

Encounters include:


Chanamas: Frog Prince...Of Darkness (EL 7): A polymorphed bone devil leads his gullible lizardfolk acolytes through the marsh in search of new recruits for his burgeoning kingdom.
Events Come To A Head (EL 5): A band of kobold raiders with a bag of (regenerating) troll heads prove a surprising encounter!
Forlorn Mother (EL 7): A distraught mother begs the PCs for aid in tracking down the evil crone Hassani who has just stolen her newborn child!
Gnawing Father (EL 3): In a terrible rage, Tranek (husband of the Forlorn Mother) hacks his way through the swamp in search of his child. Woe betide any who get in his way for he is very hungry...
Knightly Apparitions (EL 8): On an ancient battlefield lurk invisible, malicious and evil creatures that feed on the terror of those unfortunate enough to stumble into their lair.
Resolute Crone (EL 8): A sodden camp in the depths of the swamp is home to the crone Hassani and her many children.
Serpentine Sage (EL 6): The hydra diviner Chalos enjoys speaking with travellers...if he can resist the urge to eat them!
Wanderer (EL 2): Bral, Warden of the Marsh, wanders his home, keeping it safe from those who would do it ill.


This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

This ZIP file also contains a separate PDF containing the product's compiled stat blocks enabling the busy GM to build up a handy library of ready-to-go stat blocks.

120189.name: Everybody Dance
120189.description:
Get ready to rock the party! Coming exclusively to the PlayStation®3 system, Everybody Dance lets you dance to 40 of the top hip hop, pop and club favorites. Dance off against your friends in 20 player Party Mode, then show off your skills by choreographing personalized routines and challenging friends to compete against your moves. Keep the party going by uploading highlight videos and pictures to Facebook and Twitter. It’s your turn to dominate the dance floor!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120190.name: Shadow Realms: Forsaken Realms
120190.description:
From the introduction:
Shadow Realms: The Forsaken Realms written by Ben Palmer & Len Charlton is an expansion of the Shadow Realms game world, bringing the flavour of the post-holocaust mixed up with the high fantasy of the Shadow Realms setting.
Forsaken Realms is set in the future of the Western Realms, set in the ruins of a modern day civilisation. A once great technological, economical and magical society has been laid waste by unknown forces and the remaining few strive to survive and piece together what brought the Fall so they may find a solution to their Forsaken Realm.
In this new order it seems the survivors deities have abandoned them, technology is dysfunctional and lost. Without the academia the art of magic has become slowly forgotten and the spirits of nature are twisted and perverted by the change in landscape.
All the while demonic forces stalk the lands searching for fresh souls, the dead are restless stirring from their graves, cults rise up to appease their new masters and horrific diseases spread across the ravaged land. After centuries of squabbling the races of the Western Realms have set aside their differences and have banded together to retake and rebuild their world.

120191.name: Rock of the Dead
120191.description:
Grab your guitar and get your drums! The planet is under attack, and the only chance we have is through the power of rock! Rock of the Dead lets you use your guitar and drum controllers to annihilate aliens, squash mutated insects and smash up the undead zombie hordes.

Grab a buddy and play through the story-based campaign in two-player competitive co-op with guitars, drums or both! Rock out to a soundtrack featuring metalized versions of Bach, Brahms and other classical pieces as well as Rob Zombie and White Zombie hard-hitting tracks. With a cast of characters voiced by Neil Patrick Harris, Felicia Day and Rob Zombie, huge boss battles and dozens of unlockables and upgradeable special attacks, the fate of the planet is in your hands!

Source: The Game Website.

120192.name: Free-World
120192.description:
Publisher's Description:
This is the first in a trilogy of inter-galactic adventure game-books. It has 300 numbered sections and the reader plays the part of the main character - similar to Wizard book's Fighting Fantasy series. 2 dice and a pencil are needed to play. Synopsis: Dare you take on the might of the Empire to free your home planet from its clutches? You are an intergalactic Hauler who is inadvertently enlisted in the ranks of a secret rebellion operating on your once free home-world and preparing to begin a drive to free it from tyranny. Your world is one of the last to be conquered by a formidable galactic administration which has turned itself swiftly and secretively into a despotic empire. This is a perilous adventure and it may take you a few attempts to successfully complete. It is also fast-paced and exciting and is a great way to get kids of 10 and up to read a book, but also aimed at adults who love role-playing-games and inter-active gamebooks

120193.name: SingStar Dance

videogamehonor.29955: 2011 D.I.C.E. Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

120193.description:
SingStar Dance is a competitive karaoke and dance game for the PlayStation 3, and is a spin-off of the karaoke-only SingStar series. The game involves an element other than simply karaoke, and utilizes the PlayStation Move controller for dancing.

Source: Wikipedia, "SingStar Dance", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120194.name: Jet Set
120194.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Ride of Your Life

Step this way! There’s no need for you to wait in line with the riff-raff, the common clay of dirty humanity. You can have something better. You can have the good life, filled with the finest food, the most expensive wines, and the most interesting people in the world. There’s a price to pay, of course. There always is. But take a ride, just once, in the aircraft the upper crust uses, and see if you don’t like it. Get a taste of this lifestyle, and see if you won’t do anything to keep it.

In Jet Set, shadowrunners get the chance to rub elbows with the rich and powerful of the world—the socialites, the corporate elite, the royalty, the movers, and the shakers. These are people who know how to get what they want, no matter who they need to step over to get it. The runners may be the help they need to get rid of their latest obstacle—or they could be the next bodies the rich and powerful leave in an expanding trail behind them.

Jet Set is a campaign book with information on the growing tension between Sixth World dragons, the mysterious motives and questions surrounding Nadja Daviar, the opening salvos in political battles that will shake cities and nations in the next year, and more. Filled with plot details, location information, and NPC write-ups, the book is a resource all Shadowrun players can use. Jet Set is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

120195.name: A Funny Thing Happened
120195.description:
Creator's Description:
A Funny Thing Happened is a game designed to fill in the blanks in journeys. To detail the intereactions and minor foibles that whilst not central to an epic plot can still occur on any journey.

It is also intended to be playable whilst on a journey. Players take it in turns to describe the story with a dice based bidding mechanism to control conflict resolution.

You can play A Funny Thing Happened as a stand alone game or as a filler for your ongoing campaign to explain what acutally happened in the 2 week long trip that your GM glossed over in a sentence.

120196.name: So What's The Pirate Ship Like, Anyway?
120196.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your PCs have set out on an ocean voyage in search of loot and glory. As they cruise the waves, they see a distant ship on the horizon and turn toward it. As they draw closer they can make out that the ship is a pirate vessel! At that point, they ask So what’s the pirate ship like, anyway?

So What’s The Pirate Ship Like, Anyway? answers this question by presenting tables to enable a busy time-pressured GM to quickly and easily generate the ship’s name, captain’s name, flag and figurehead as well as providing tables to enable the PCs to make Knowledge checks to learn more about the vessel—including the ship itself as well as the captain, crew and their exploits. (You even get three stat blocks of typical pirates to hurl against your PCs!)

If you are running a nautical-based adventure featuring pirates, So What’s The Pirate Ship Like, Anyway? is for you!

This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for useon a mobile device such as an iPad.

120197.name: SingStar SuomiHitit
120197.description:
User Summary

For the third time in the SingStar karaoke game series, the songlist consists entirely of Finnish artists. The PS3 edition includes 30 songs, while the PS2 edition has 25 songs.

120198.name: SingStar SuomiSuosikit
120198.description:
User Summary

For the fourth time in the SingStar karaoke game series, the songlist consists entirely of Finnish artists. The PS3 edition includes 30 songs, while the PS2 edition has 25 songs.

120199.name: GamesMaster Catalog:  A Comprehensive Illustrated Guide to Games
120199.description:
From the back cover
This is the first comprehensive catalog on games.

The new fully-illustrated GamesMaster Catalog contains photographs, descriptions and prices of the products manufactured by over 190 games companies. Nearly half of the 1,000 items listed are in full color. The GamesMaster Catalog is the most complete and up-to-date source available - an essential reference book for every game enthusiast!

Contents

Introduction
Fantasy Role-Playing Games, Adventures & Playing Aids
Fantasy & Mythology Games
Science Fiction & Science Fantasy Games
Historical & Contemporary Games
Gaming Miniatures & Miniature Rules
Accessories for Gaming
Computer, Video & Electronic Games
Educational & Children's Games
Sports Games
Leisure Time & Family Games
Books & Magazines
Play-By-Mail (PBM) Games
Future Releases
Manufacturers Index
Game Category Index
Product Index
1981 Game Convention Calendar

120200.name: 1000 Heroz
120200.description:
Imagine a game that lasts 1000 days. A new hero to control, a new adventure to embark on, a new relic to find every single day. That game is 1000 Heroz.

1000 Heroz is the second game in the Heroz franchise, and the first for iPhone. In 1000 Heroz, you take control of a new hero every day you play. Your task is to guide them through a brand new adventure, to find a hidden relic and get the fastest time possible.

1000 Heroz is an original mixture of platforming and racing. Physics-based jumping makes going for the fastest time fun, while varying obstacles offer enough challenge to weed out the wimps. GameCenter functionality and custom friend leagues let you compete with your friends and gamers all over the world. Facebook Connect functionality gives you the perfect opportunity to taunt your friends after hitting the perfect run.

Source: The Publisher Website.

120201.name: Death Under Tuscan Skies: A Dana Knightstone Novel
120201.description:
Journey across Italy as best-selling novelist Dana Knightstone in Death Under Tuscan Skies: A Dana Knightstone Novel! During a lecture in a university in Tuscany, you are startled by the ghost of a 19th century girl named Eva. Decades ago, she died of a mysterious illness while her lover Giovanni left to find a cure. Why did he never return? Unravel the mystery of his disappearance as you explore beautiful landscapes in this incredible Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120202.name: Psi*Run (Revised)
120202.description:
publisher blurb

Whoever’s after you, you know one thing: they will stop at nothing to capture you and you’ll stop at nothing to stay free. The holes in your memory vie for attention with your startling abilities - stay one step ahead of the Chasers long enough to answer your questions, and hope your psychic powers don’t go wild.

They took your life.
You got away.
They want you back.
Run!

120203.name: Death at Fairing Point: A Dana Knightstone Novel
120203.description:
Can you solve a 19th century murder? You are Dana Knightstone, an up-and-coming fiction novelist. While on vacation in Scotland, you are haunted by the ghost of David, a working-class painter in love with a rich heiress - until he was killed at Fairing Point! Uncover history as you travel across Europe to investigate David's mysterious death. Solve clever puzzles and follow the ghost's trail in Death at Fairing Point, a fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

120205.name: The Lord of the Rings Online: Riders of Rohan

videogameseries.28012: The Lord of the Rings Online

videogameexpansion.77210: The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar

120205.description:
Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment unveiled today The Lord of the Rings Online™: Riders of Rohan™, the latest expansion to the award-winning free-to-play massively multiplayer online roleplaying game (MMORPG) developed by Turbine. Riders of Rohan expands the online world of Middle-earth where players join forces to ride into the Plains of Rohan. Riders of Rohan launches in the Fall of 2012 with an increased level cap, the vast plains of Rohan including iconic locations such as Amon Hen and Fangorn Forest, the new Mounted Combat system and much more!

“2011 was another banner year for The Lord of the Rings Online with consistent growth for the game, a successful unification of our European and North American services and the success of Rise of Isengard, our best selling expansion to date.” said Kate Paiz, Executive Producer of The Lord of the Rings Online. “This is going to be another outstanding year as we celebrate our fifth anniversary and introduce a wealth of new content throughout the year, ending with our arrival in Rohan. One of our largest expansions ever, Rohan is expected to be twice the size of the recent Rise of Isengard expansion and includes the most new game systems and technology we've introduced since 2008's Mines of Moria.”

NEW FEATURES:

Experience the Riders of Rohan – Join with the Rohirrim and ride across the sprawling Plains of Rohan; witness the breaking of the Fellowship at Amon Hen; forge alliances with the Ents of Fangorn; and aid Éomer, adopted son of Théoden, as he seeks to protect his homeland from the growing Shadow.

Introducing Mounted Combat – Ride into Combat atop your loyal War-steed as you defend the people of Rohan from the forces of Isengard and Mordor. Customize your War-steed’s armor and level its skills over time to aid you in mounted defense of King Theoden’s lands. Mount your steed and gather your fellows to fight against Warbands, contingents of roving warg riders that have been scouted all over the Plains of Rohan! It falls to you to head off and defeat this new threat before they over take the land.

Advance to level 85 – Continue your legend in the next chapter of The Lord of the Rings Online. Experience new adventures in the epic story, and gain new skills and deeds as you face new challenges on your journey to 85!

The Lord of the Rings Online is the ultimate adventure. This award-winning massively multiplayer online role-playing game delivers an interactive experience brimming with life and filled with the familiar people, places and monsters from the most famous fantasy of all time. From the picturesque surroundings of the Shire to Moria, the most fearsome underground realm ever imagined, players can experience the world of Middle-earth for free! For more information, visit www.lotro.com.

Source: The Developer Website.

120206.description:
2nd in the series of Touhou Shisouroku, a crossover between the fantasy world of Gensokyo and Dominion.

A standalone expansion featuring 25 new kingdom cards pooled from various Dominion expansions such as Intrigue, Prosperity and Cornucopia.

Gameplay is exactly the same as Dominion, where players purchase cards from a common pool and utilise them to accrue the largest number of victory points at the end of the game.

In Gensokyo, people relax and bask in the calm of a winter without end. Spring has shown no sign of arriving even though it's already May, and in fact the snowstorms are continually getting worse. Reimu Hakurei, a shrine maiden of the Hakurei Shrine, is tired of being cold day in and day out and wants to find the source of this unnatural weather. Marisa Kirisame, a black-clothed magician, sees a cherry blossom petal float down outside her warm house and wonders if spring is happening somewhere else. Sakuya Izayoi, the maid leader of the Scarlet Devil Mansion, knows that their winter supplies are diminishing quickly, and wants to end this prolonged winter before they run out completely.

Taken from en.touhouwiki.net
120206.name: Touhou Shisouroku: Touhou Youyoumu-hen

120207.name: ไดโนฟาร์ม บิวด์เกม: เปิดฟาร์มสวนสนุกยุคไดโนเสาร์
120207.description:
English Translation title
"Dinofarm Buildgame: Open Amusement Park Farm in Dinosaur Era"

The card game that be added to the educational-purposed comic-like book with same title.

This is stand alone expansion of ไดโนฟาร์ม บิวด์เกม: มาสร้างฟาร์มสัตว์ล้านปีกัน / Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm. As in Dinofarm, you are a dinosaur rancher and you build the farm and raise the dinosaurs or reptiles from Mezoic era.

All rules are as same as Dinofarm, but there are additional rules and added Event Cards as the sub-type of Farm card. The game flow - at the start of the round, 2 Assistance cards is dealt to each player. Start from the starting player each player solves their turn by drawing 2 Dinosaur cards and play 3 actions from 4 available (Build Farm, Raise dinosaur, play Assistance card and discard and re-deal the farm card in the market). At the end of round, all player discard their Assistance cards and shuffle all Assistance cards to rebuild the Assistance deck. You can buy and play as Farm card, but discard it after solving.

Winning the game by having the most victory point at the end of the game. The victory point is calculate at the end of game by the Farm Card and raised Dinosaur Card in the farm.

Combined with Dinofarm,this can be played by up to 8 players.

Integrates with:

ไดโนฟาร์ม บิวด์เกม: มาสร้างฟาร์มสัตว์ล้านปีกัน / Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm

120208.name: Le Grand Jeu du Peuple Migrateur
120208.description:
"Winged Migration" in English
The game uses the principle of migration, you are a bird and you try to make your trip the best conditions, avoiding the pitfalls Racing game like Snakes and Ladders with cards events, issues, etc.

Each player is a migratory bird. The goal is to achieve complete its migration and reconstruct the puzzle bird as quickly as possible.
Once a player has met the six pieces of his puzzle, he must go to the finish to win the game having completed its "migration".

Player rolls the dice and move forward or backward

120209.name: Lanfeust de Troy CCG
120209.description:
Each player has 40 cards that make up its game cards are either characters (heroes, village ...), magic, creatures, objects or places, all from the world of Lanfeust of Troy.
Each player represents a wise man who manages to start a group of villagers. Group that, throughout the game, grew in size and weapon, gets help from creatures, use of magic, visits to weaken the enemy wise.

The goal is to be the strongest or least injured at the end of the game.

In turn, each player performs in succession all the following phases:
1. managing the presence of heroes
2. care management of the characters and creatures
3. draws 2 cards
4. completion of 6 shares of its choice (ask a character, a creature, make use of magic, give an object to a character, use an action (the power) of a character placed in his camp ...
During these six stocks, the adversary can achieve in one and only.
5. launch an attack (either a general attack with all his forces, an attack with all characters flying and flying creatures, an attack against creature creature).
6. managing the presence of heroes
7. return of the hero in the neutral zone
8. discard any cards from his hand.

Once the player has completed all its phases, it is his opponent to do the same. And so on until the end of the game that occurs when a player received 10 wounds or one player has more cards in his deck.

Contents in the starter decks:

2 sets of 40 cards (each set includes 28 common cards, 9 cards unusual and rare 3)
40 chips (20 "P", 20 "Axes")
A 6-sided dice
1 Rulebook 23-page

120210.name: Anzio: Operation Shingle
120210.description:
Anzio: Operation Shingle covers the initial Allied landings on the 22nd January to the failure of the second German offensive, Operation Seitensprung, to eliminate the beachhead on the 1st March. The whole campaign can be replayed as well as several scenarios covering key parts of the battle. The game also allows alternative plans to be explored such as the original plan for the US 504th parachute regiment to be airdropped just outside Carroceto on the Via Anziate.

Extract from draft design notes...

…In order to calculate the hex grid needed I looked into the area required to deploy regimental sized units. German, American and British regimental units varied in size and composition, and by 1944 most units were suffering some level of depletion of manpower. Couple this with documented doctrinal frontages rarely being achieved on the ground and the calculation of accurate frontages becomes very problematic. A German infantry division in 1944 had three infantry regiments as well as an assortment of artillery, support and HQ companies and battalions. Each German infantry regiment consisted of two battalions. Bull (2005) states a German battalion in an attack frontage would occupy 400-1000m, and Rottman (2004) has their defensive frontage as 800-2000m. Disregarding any particular formations if these two battalions were placed in line the regiment would need:

German Regimental Frontages
Attack 800-2000m ½ mile to 1¼ miles
Defense 1600-4000m 1 mile to 2½ miles

British brigades (equivalent to regiments) and US regiments were somewhat larger than their German counterparts, having an additional infantry battalion. Doctrine would seldom recommend placing all of a regiments units in line, with some elements held back in reserve, so using with the above German calculation offers a useful yardstick.

The next design problem then emerged, how to simulate the different frontages of units and the particular advantages and disadvantages of each? Units in a defensive frontage should be able to defend a longer front and have some defensive advantage. Units in an attack frontage should be able to concentrate their strength and have the advantage of easier movement. The game simulates different frontages by allowing units to be within a single hex (attack frontage) or two hexes (defensive frontage) - additional aspects of the differing frontages are discussed later.

So using the German regimental frontage above I calculated that a single hex needed to be able to contain a regiment in an attack frontage of ½ to 1¼ miles. Taking into account that the allied formations were a little larger a scale of 1½ miles across each hex seems suitable. A regiment in a defensive frontage would cover around 3 miles. Each hex contains around 3½ square miles.

This hex grid was then placed over a map of the campaign area and adjustments made in order for the grid to fit…

120212.name: Wizardry and Witchcraft
120212.description:
Publisher blurb:

Welcome to Wizardry and Witchcraft, a game in a book that helps you tell stories. Stories rooted in fairy-tale, but in a setting of today, or at least yesterday.

The inspiration has been the works of J.K.Rowling. She told a story whose atmosphere inspired millions about the young wizard Harry Potter, and with this book you will also be able to tell such a story together with your friends.

120213.name: Gollipop
120213.description:
Shooting game featuring a highly collectible Golliwog as the target. The idea is to shoot off his buttons and his eyes with your Air Pop-Gun.

Each player takes equal turns and the one with the most successes, wins.

120214.name: Stick Stacks
120214.description:
A dexterity game in the mould of later games like Jenga. In this game players must build sticks on to a structure. As the sticks get higher, it becomes increasingly more difficult. The sticks are rounded like a straw which increases the difficulty level even higher.

Three dice decide which colours you need to take. Red sticks are the longest, blue sticks are medium length and green are the smallest.

Your turn is against the clock so you need to be pretty fast. If you knock down the stick tower, you lose that game. Play as many games as you want and the winner is the one with fewest losses.

120215.name: The Dover Road Shooting Game
120215.description:
Straightforward target game but with some flair for relating to the title. In the 18th century, coach travellers were often accosted by highwaymen and the Dover Road was a popular haunt, lying as it does between London and the port of Dover.

The targets, in period dress, are the coach itself, one alarmed passenger, one passenger who has just been shot and the highwayman.

The gun is operated by a rubber band but just look at the appearance, as near as they could get to an 18th century pistol.

The winner is the one with the most hits after the game ends.

120216.name: Kelbazar Junior
120216.description:
El Bazar junior version.

Simple game in which players are trying to make something that they have on drawn tile (an animal, an object, a thing) using wooden elements. When the opponent guesses what you are building you both score a point. If not, next players is trying to make others to guess.

Text on the backside of the box:
How can a plane, a watering can or even a doll be presented using wooden shapes? Guaranteed giggles for the whole family...

Contents:

120 tiles (toys, animals and objects)
17 wooden shapes
sand timer

120217.description:
City of Horror is a backstabbing survival-horror game. As in classic zombie movies, a shambling horde is invading the city. The goal is to survive the assault. (Un)fortunately, surviving often means sacrificing some of your fellow players to the undead...

Each player controls several characters with different abilities; these characters can move to various limited-capacity locations, which they can then barricade and scavenge for items and weapons. Critical situations, such as zombies breaking in and eating a character, are resolved using a vote.

The basic game mechanisms are the same as in Mall of Horror (also designed by Nicolas Normandon), but City of Horror differs in both materials and game play in a number of ways: the city map changes each game, twenty characters are included, they can use antidotes (or die), action cards become scarce as the game goes on, you can gain points with stuff other than surviving characters...
120217.name: City of Horror

120218.description:
Second game in the Squad Seven saga.

This time the adventure takes place in the great desert of northern Sudan. The Squads explore the mysterious ruins of a temple buried under the sands in order to find the fabulous treasures, but also something else ... may be evidence that we are not alone in the universe and it may already be among us. Clues are hidden on the game cards.

Players choose their squad and enter the desert and take the turns to reveal cards, which may show treasure or various dangers. Many cards require the player to shoot a target or run round the table before a scream is heard on the soundtrack CD. If they fail, they lose a member of their squad.

The player who recovers the most treasure wins the game.
120218.name: Squad Seven II: Le spectre d'Imhotek

120219.name: Up and Over
120219.description:
One of the type of game that the British, in particular, liked to play.

Each horse is attached to a length of string. By 'jiggling' the string, your horse can be made to move forward and, when a jump is reached, a different use of the string will allow your horse to 'jump' the fence. A fair amount of dexterity and finesse is needed with the aforementioned actions. The horses have two bases you might say, one flat and one rounded (it works exactly the same as a wheel would).

The first to finish the course, wins.

120221.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 39 - Jan 1999)
120221.description: This issue contains the 3rd part of the Morh-Khaddur campaign for DSA "Ein Wald voller Gefahren" and the 4th part of the coin campaign "Eine Münze aus Holz"

120222.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 40 - Jun 1999)
120222.description: This issue contains the famiy report "Rommilys" with some scenario ideas for DSA

videogame.73804: Disciples II: Guardians of the Light

120223.name: Disciples II: Gallean's Return

videogamecompilation.73804: Disciples II: Guardians of the Light

120223.description:
User Summary

This is the compilation of two Disciples II expansions:
-Guardians of the Light
-Servants of the Dark

120224.name: Dirt-Track Racing for Motor Cycles
120224.description:
Speedway was so popular in Britain in the 1930's, many games reflected this.

This is a simple roll and move game. If your bike lands on one of many illustrated spaces, you must follow the instructions.

First to reach the finish-line, wins.

120225.name: Ting-a-Ling
120225.description:
The game consists of a board with 6 holes which stands on two wooden blocks and in each of the holes hangs a bell. There are 2 large and 6 small tiddleywinks. The idea of the game is to propel your counters, Tiddleywinks fashion, and you score points for each tiddleywink that you fire through the holes with bonus scores for ringing the bells on the way through.

The rules are on a sheet attached to the inside of the box.

Highest score wins.

120226.name: International Football Game
120226.description:
An action game for two football fans.

The board features several indentations which are long and thin. Each indentation has a player attached, and by moving levers at your end of the table, you can slide your footballer forward or back in order to 'kick' the ball. The ball is magnetic so that it is attracted to the nearest indentation once it has been kicked.

The winner is the one with the most goals after a pre-agreed time limit has expired.

120227.name: First Quest: The Music
120227.description:
User summary:

An electronic music album, released in double vinyl and cassette versions, which also contained an Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition) adventure by Dave Miller on the inner protective sleeves (vinyl version) or the inlay (cassette version). The adventure is designed to follow the story created by the track listing on the album.

Released by Filmtrax under licence to TSR, in the UK only.

From the introduction:

First Quest is an adventure for a very high level party. Even with characters of 15th level and better, players are going to find it difficult; consequently they may wish to use one or more of the characters set out below.

Pre-generated characters of levels 15 to 22 are provided.

Information on the author of the adventure taken from The Acaeum.

120228.name: Monopoly: Buxtehude
120228.description: Monopoly set in Buxtehude, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120229.name: Monopoly: Erlangen
120229.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Erlangen, in Germany.

120230.name: Monopoly: Fehmarn
120230.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Fehmarn, in Germany.

120231.name: Monopoly: Bonn
120231.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bonn, in Germany.

120232.name: Monopoly: Borussia Dortmund
120232.description: Monopoly with Borussia Dortmund, the famous soccer team from Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

120233.name: ESPN 2 Xtreme
120233.description:
User Summary

ESPN 2 Xtreme is a sequel to ESPN Extreme Games. Similar to the first game players can race either by themselves or against a friend. This game features skateboarding, rollerblading, biking, and snowboarding on 12 different tracks/levels.

120234.name: Mashed

videogamehonor.29379: 2004 Golden Joystick Unsung Hero Game of the Year Nominee

120234.description:
Mashed is a top-down racing/vehicular combat game, similar in style to Micro Machines, Circuit Breakers, and Super Sprint.

Each race consists of four vehicles. The player has to navigate various obstacles and obtain weapon pickups to succeed. The game operates a left-behind principle: the camera tries to keep all players in one screen, and if one drops far enough behind in the race, they are eliminated, and the other players race on. This continues until there is one player left, who is given two points, while the rest of the racers also gain or lose points depending on their final position in the round. The system then repeats until a player reaches a set number of points, usually 10 or 12. In multiplayer, knocked out players have the option of striking cars still racing with partially controlled missiles, known as airstrikes.

In North America, Mashed was eventually released in late 2006 for PS2 and Xbox, simply titled as "Drive to Survive", which was also the original subtitle for the game. It is notable that the game was later re-priced at $10.

This version contained multiple game fixes, extra weapons, vehicles and tracks, as it was developed on a different engine to that of the first game. Also, the game featured improved sound, graphics and load times.

Mashed Fully Loaded features 15 main tracks or courses:

Angel Peak
Kharga Temple
Neustein
Fort Gidlow
Ventura Boulevard
Demolition
Keister Bay
Polar Wharf
Tierra Piedra
Koko Bay
Silver Creek
Timgidski
Redpool Tip
Nukov
Hattan City

Mashed Fully Loaded features 9 weapon types:

Proximity Mine: This weapon allows you to place up to two proximity mines behind you. When you place a mine it takes one second to arm itself. When armed proximity mines are colored red. The mine will explode when a vehicle drives over it or passes close by.

Drum Bomb: This weapon allows you to throw devastating exploding barrels behind you. The explosion can often be enough to take out a whole pack of drivers behind you.

Oil Slick: This allows you to pour oil over the road behind you, again great for corners. Oil on the road makes driving a car very difficult!

Flamethrower: This rear-firing weapon deals in napalm death! Toast the car behind you and watch them burn!

Shotgun: This unique sideways firing weapon allows you to attack two enemies simultaneously. Just pull up next to an enemy and blow the sucker away. Do it right and it’ll throw most cars in the air.

Homing Missile: This is the most powerful weapon available in Mashed. It uses a laser sight, that when locked on to an enemy turns from the color green to red. When it’s locked on fire away!

Machine Gun: This baby allows you to gun down any foe in front. It uses a laser sight that turns red when locked on. Every bullet that hits will make it harder for your enemies to control their cars while causing damage.

Flash Bang: This weapon can be particularly effective on the turns. If you fire it when your opponents are trying to negotiate a precarious corner, they won’t be able to tell where they are going. Just be careful when to use it, because you’ll be partially blinded as well!

Mortar: This long distance weapon gives you three shots. The best thing about this sucker is that it has some homing capability, making it very dangerous in the right hands.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mashed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120235.name: Melty Blood
120235.description:
Melty Blood (メルティブラッド Meruti Buraddo), is a visual novel and fighting game, co-developed by dōjin circles Type-Moon and French-Bread, originally released at Comiket on December 2002. It is shortened as simply Merubura (メルブラ). Based on Type Moon's visual novel game, Tsukihime, it later spawned an arcade version, titled Act Cadenza, the first Type-Moon title to receive a PlayStation 2 port.

The story of Melty Blood follows one year after Tsukihime. Shiki Tohno hears of a new series of murders in Misaki similar to the one's that took place Tsukihime. Whilst searching for the murderer he meets Sion Eltnam Atlasia who initiates a fight with him, attempting to capture him. After the fight she reveals that her reason for trying to capture him is to get in contact with the "True Ancestor" (referring to Arcueid) so that she may acquire information on the "cure for vampirism". Shiki then decides to help her with this task.

The story moves through a series of fights. Depending on the outcome of the fight the story will branch in one of two ways. Ultimately this corresponds to the ending of the game.

Only six characters were available to be played, with eight more being unlockable through story-mode. However, in a later update released for the game (the 'Nero' patch), all the characters are available from the start. The reasons for this are slightly unclear; they appear to be the result of a legal misunderstanding whereby Type-Moon mistakenly thought they would no longer be allowed to produce updates/patches, and thus made a 'last patch' which unlocked the characters as a sort of gift for the fans. Whatever the reason, Type-Moon has left these characters available throughout all subsequent releases.
