The game also heavily expands on the previous game's RPG mode, and is the first in the series to use CGI cutscenes. The player also has the ability to summon other characters, such as Gamabunta.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120318.name: Cannons & Cutthroats
120318.description:
Play as a pirate, Captain of your own ship! Your goal is to obtain the most gold: the pirating way! In game you will: obtain precious treasures, hold prisoners captive, blast your opponents with cannons, and board enemy ships to steal their booty!

C&C uses a unique cannon combat mechanic where players must find or trade for gunpowder and ammunition in order to fire their cannons. Players can use cannonballs to sink enemy ships, chain-shot to make players lose turns (to repair their masts!), or grapeshot to clear the opponent's deck of crew.

Crew are used for boarding enemy ships to steal their cargo. Crew can be equipped with pistols, muskets, rapiers, or cutlasses in order to increase their chance of success. If victorious, crew are able to steal cards from the opposing player, whether that be supplies or gold. Treasure cards will trade hands multiple times before the next Port! card is found where the players can take a breather before the next round of raids and cannon bombardments begin.

This is a dice and card game that relies heavily on luck. In this sense, its best suited for casual gamers who are looking for a medium length game (30-60 minutes) that has excitement in every turn.

The game includes rules, two D6 dice, and 136 poker-size cards.

120319.name: Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja 4
120319.description:
Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja 4 known in Japan as Naruto Shippuden: Narutimate Accel (ＮＡＲＵＴＯ－ナルト－ 疾風伝 ナルティメットアクセル Naruto Shippūden: Narutimetto Akuseru) is the fourth installment of the Ultimate Ninja series, and the first in the Accels completely redone and improved scenes from Naruto Ultimate Ninja 3. The game features over 52 characters (including transformations) and also has an original story mode new to the series that takes place between the Sasuke Retrieval Arc and the Shippuden Arc called The Black Shadow.

The game introduces Naruto Shippūden characters for the first time, featuring over 52 playable characters. Other changes include the introduction of fixed ultimate jutsu, which change as health decreases or if the player enters any secondary mode. The graphical style of the game has also been toned down, retaining the anime look. Hero's History Mode includes completely redone and improved scenes from Naruto Ultimate Ninja 3 as well as redone CGI scenes.

A new mode in the game called Master Mode also allows players to compete in challenging missions, explore the massive world of Shippuden and level up character. The game covers half of the "Kidnapped" arc from the Shippuden storyline.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naruto: Ultimate Ninja", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120320.name: Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja 5
120320.description:
Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja 5, known in Japan as, Naruto Shippuden: Narutimate Accel 2 (ＮＡＲＵＴＯ－ナルト－ 疾風伝 ナルティメットアクセル２ Naruto Shippuden: Narutimetto Akuseru 2), is the fifth installment in the Ultimate Ninja series. The game continues the Naruto Shippuden storyline, going up to the first meeting between Naruto and Sasuke in the anime.

One of the new gameplay additions is the introduction of assist characters. Assist characters are chosen during character selection, and can be called in during a match to deal extra damage. Certain combinations of characters create unique jutsus in a match; these combinations reflect the associations of those characters in the anime and manga. Many of the character's jutsus from the previous game were updated. There are many updated ultimate jutsus, including the aforementioned assist-specific ones. Summons have been removed from the game. The assist characters cannot be turned off.

The game also includes an RPG mode where players can roam sections of the village and interact with the surroundings of the story and villagers. Also the game includes an extra arc which Tsunade assigns Team Kakashi to re-investigate Orochimaru's hideout in the Hidden Grass village.

Source: Wikipedia, "Naruto: Ultimate Ninja", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120323.name: Chaos Isle Deluxe Survivor's Kit
120323.description:
What Has Come To Pass
It wasn’t long ago that Dr. Zycheck’s experiments for immortality went awry and he was transformed into the undead thing known as The Creator. Further experimentation with creatures both living and dead quickly caused the Isle to become overrun with his Zombi monstrosities. Many tried to escape the Isle and others barricaded themselves in their cellars hoping to ride out the storm, while a few brave heroes did what they could to end the madness. Most didn’t make it. Professor Mortimus Philbin, Dr. Zycheck’s former assistant, rose to challenge The Creator with his self-made army of Exterminators, designed to do battle with Dr. Z’s minions. Unfortunately, the Exterminators were nothing more than mindless Cyber Zombis who slaughtered the living when the walking dead weren’t available as targets.

Just when it seemed things couldn’t get any worse, the Virus began to transform and spread like a plague, holding the Isle hostage within its deathly grip. Zombis began to mutate and hordes of the undead were being driven by powerful new masters. The heroes fought valiantly to save the Isle, but the virus-fueled undead seemed impossible to overcome. The Virus had infected the Heroes as well, however, empowering them to perform amazing feats that could be used to stop the onslaught. But rather than using their new found abilities to save the Isle, they began to work against each other in a desperate struggle for self-preservation.

The Creator stood to reign triumphant as the Isle swiftly fell into the hands of the dead, but the Brood Mother emerged from a vile cesspool of the darkest Virus. A creature with an insatiable appetite for both the living and the dead, she began to even the odds. Now, in the Isle’s darkest hour, The Creator, the Brood Mother, and the survivors of Chaos Isle face off in a final battle to either save the Isle, or doom it forever.

Game Overview
Chaos Isle is a zombie-themed card game that can be played solo or by up to 6 players using just a single deck. The game is played using cards separated into 6 different decks, including Mission, Character, Equipment, Feat, Virus and Enemy cards consisting of Tasks, Events, Mutations and Zombis. Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck places each player in the role of one of the Characters, with each attempting to be the first to complete their mission and all the while fending off 14 different Zombi enemies.

120326.name: Battleship (1997)
120326.description:
User Summary

Hasbro brings the classic naval warfare game to the PC with this entry, providing both the familiar "Classic" Battleship, as well as a variant called "Ultimate" Battleship. Classic Battleship can be played against the AI, or with up to 3 other players by hotseat or LAN/Internet. Ultimate Battleship puts a new twist on the original game by introducing islands and aircraft, among other things.

120327.name: New Men Checkers
120327.description:
It is played on a 8x8 checkerboard. Every rank has 24 men, 20 ordinary and 4 with determined characteristics. The board is numbered from a1 to h8.

The pieces are collocated on squares dark and clear. Pieces on a1 and h1 (a8 and h8 for Black) are called asterisk, because are marked with a green asterisk. They move and capture diagonally and vertically (forwards and backwards) but capture diagonally forwards with a long jump like flying king. When it reaches the last row and become king, this one moves diagonally, vertically and horizontally with a long jump, but captures diagonally and vertically.

The pieces on d1 (e8 for Black) are marked with a blue exclamation point and are called expoint. They move and capture diagonally and vertically (forward and backwards), but capture diagonally backwards with a long jump like flying king. When it reached the last row and become king, it moves and captures diagonally vertically and horizontally.

The pieces collocated on e1 (d8 for Black) are marked with a red across, and are called across. It move and capture diagonally and vertically (backwards and forwards), but capture horizontally with a long jump. When they reach the last row and become king, this one moves and captures (diagonally, vertically and horizontally),and it can not captured by men.

Simple men when it reach the last row after a capture and have still possibilities to catch, it go on to capture and not become King at the moment.Wins who blocks or captures all enemy pieces.

120328.name: Victory Spark
120328.description:
Japanese Collectible card game.

The game objective is about a player who order the character card to try to knock down the opponent's character and much as possible.

Each side of battlefield in the game have a Character in the front. That zone called as "Ring". And up to 3 supporting character behind. That zone called as "Bench". Only a main Character in the "Ring" can attack the opposing character that also in the "Ring". Each attacking requires to rest a supporting character in the "Bench" (like Magic the Gathering's Tapping). The damage is commutative until the attacked character are knocked down. Knocked-down character is remove to the zone called "Retired zone" and then immediately put the card from the top of the deck to the "Ring" face up, solve its effect before next attacking. The winner is a player who can make the opponent reaches 10 character in the "Retired zone".

Card type in this have only one type, the character card.

Constructed deck consists exactly 50 cards.

120329.name: Battleship: Surface Thunder
120329.description:
From the instruction manual

The classic game of naval strategy reaches new levels of fun and excitement in the Battleship: Surface Thunder game. Get read for fast-paced action as you take command of your very own battleship. In the Arcade Adventure, set sail for hostile waters where you'll fight a renegade navy intent on overthrowing a peaceful kingdom. You'll have your hands full as you blast shore emplacements, attack shipping convoys, and match your wits with enemy ships, planes and submarines. Power-ups will give you the health, speed and weapons you need to fight your way past enemy forces. Also, enjoy an updated version of the classic Battleship game, where wits and strategy count for as much as sheer firepower.

120330.name: Save the Everglades Card Game
120330.description:
Save the Everglades Game is a 2-4 player card game that is not only fun to play, but is educational as well!

Players take turns drawing and playing cards while collecting 15 of some of the Everglades' most interesting animals.

Players can block collection of animals by playing action cards that can pollute another Player's Environments or take away their Animal Cards.

Each animal card reveals a beautifully illustrated and detailed representation of a bird, fish, reptile or mammal.

120331.name: The Heroes of the 357th
120331.description:
Back of Box

Fly with World War II's finest pilots. The 357th Fighter Group.

Based on the actual missions of one of the top fighter groups of World War II, Heroes of the 357th combines historical accuracy with challenging gameplay. Enlist in the 357th Fighter Group and fly with real American aces such as Leonard "Kit" Carson and Bud Anderson in a classic fight for the sky against the deadly German Luftwaffe.

Become a Member of the 357th.


Choose the Tour of Duty option and join the roster of aces.
Cinematic pre-flight briefings.
Pilot a realistically modelled P-51D Mustang.
Engage a multitude of air and ground targets.
Impact the success of the group.
Receive post flight advice from your mates in the Officers' Club.


Fly the Actual Combat Missions of the 357th.


Fly fighter sweeps to achieve air superiority.
Escort U.S. bombers over occupied Europe.
Drop bombs and fire rockets during ground attack missions.
Dive bomb enemy factories, shipping and bridges.
Test special weapons against ground targets.
Intercept V-1 Buzz Bombs before they hit England.
Practice your tactics during training flights.


(Inset box)

"The Yoxford Boys"
Aircraft: P-51D Mustang
Stationed: Leiston, England
Number of Combat Missions: 318
Number of Kills: 688
Aces on Roster: 52

120333.name: Pilomino
120333.description:
Rounded doninoes what can place on top of each other forming a domino stack if half of the domino is same. If player can't play he must draw many dominoes he can play.

Player who drops the stack is eliminated from the game and puts his dominoes back to the supply.

The game ends when one player gets rid of all your dominoes. He is the winner.

120335.name: Sonic Drift
120335.description:
User Summary

Sonic Drift is a kart-racing game featuring characters from the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise. Players race around tracks while collecting rings and using powerups. The game was originally only released in Japan, but has been featured in other regions via various compilations.

120336.name: Sonic Labyrinth
120336.description:
"Sonic Labyrinth is a puzzle-come-platform game for the Sega Game Gear, released 17 November 1995 in Japan and in 1995 in North America and Europe. It is also playable on Sonic Adventure DX and in the PC, PlayStation 2 and Xbox editions of Sonic Mega Collection Plus. The game features isometric gameplay similar to the SegaSonic the Hedgehog arcade game and Sonic 3D. Sonic and Dr. Eggman are the only characters in this game."

"Players control Sonic by moving them around a pinball-like arena, using their power to roll into a ball to defeat Badniks and pick up keys in order to exit through the GOAL door to clear the stage. The only move Sonic can use in the game is the Spin Dash, because Dr. Eggman secretly replaced his famous red shoes with another pair: the Slow-Down Boots that took away his ability to run fast or jump, and they cannot be removed at all without the use of Chaos Emerald energy. Sonic does retain his ability to walk and Spin Dash, however there is a time limit in each stage so it is best to move quickly."

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Labyrinth", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120337.description:
Characters from the comic strip ask questions about love and sex and make various funny tests for younger audiance 8+.

On certain squares players have a different tasks: ask questions, making mimes, making objects with clay, drawing, truth test, challenges etc.

The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the square "arrived". For this, players move from square to square and make succesfully different tests and answer different questions.
120337.name: Titeuf zizi sexuel le jeu

120338.name: Sonic Blast
120338.description:
"Sonic Blast is a video game in the Sonic the Hedgehog series developed by Aspect and published by Sega for the Sega Game Gear. It is known as G Sonic in Japan. It was released in December 1996 for both North American and European markets. A Japanese release followed later that year on December 13, being the last commercial title released for the system.[1]

The game was also ported to the Sega Master System in Brazil by TecToy and released in December 1997.

Sonic Blast was later compiled with other Sonic titles in Sonic Adventure DX and Sonic Mega Collection Plus, and a demo of its ending can be unlocked in Sonic Gems Collection.

While this game was released at the end of 1996 in conjunction with the similarly named Sonic 3D Blast, the games have little in common. No enemies, levels, or bosses are shared between them. The story is also completely different; Sonic and Knuckles join together to collect five of the Chaos Emeralds and confront Eggman at Silver Castle."

"Unlike its pseudo-3D counterpart, Sonic Blast for Game Gear was a side-scrolling run and jump platform game. It was the last new Sonic the Hedgehog game released for the Sega handheld, and sported some of the most advanced features of the 8-bit series (although it was not very well received).

The two playable characters in the game are Sonic the Hedgehog and Knuckles the Echidna. The object of the game is to collect five Chaos Emeralds, in stages visually similar to the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 special stages, but instead require Sonic and Knuckles to collect rings as in Sonic the Hedgehog 2's special stages. Emeralds can only be obtained in the second act of each level. Finishing a special stage in the first act will gain the player an extra life instead. Similar to Sonic 3, special stages are entered through large rings hidden in the regular stages.

Much like Sonic Triple Trouble, when the player is hit by an enemy, he only loses some of his rings as opposed to all of them (in this game, 10 rings per hit). Sonic's maneuvers are similar to those in other games, but he has a special double-jump ability that allows him to reach greater heights, like with the electric shield in Sonic 3. Knuckles's abilities are his standard climbing and gliding, as seen in Sonic and Knuckles."

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Blast", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120339.name: Wouégo: Le Quiz Musical
120339.description:
Wouégo is a music quiz, which means that players must recognize musical excerpts.

The game features three CDs containing 99 tracks of original music clips and 600 questions on the cards.
The goal of the game is to find who sings and answer questions.

The game can be played as a team.

120340.name: Tiens Bon Spider-Man
120340.description:
Similar to Knockout but withou dice.
In order to win: do not let Spider-Man down!
Each player equips an arm and knocked down Venom, and in his turn push one brick out from the wall.
The more skillful player wins.

120343.name: Quarrel

videogamehonor.32826: 2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

120343.description:
Quarrel is a video game developed by Denki and published by UTV Ignition Entertainment. It is a word-based strategy game, described as "Scrabble x Risk x Countdown."

In Quarrel, the aim of the game is to take all the territory from the other players (up to four). To do this, the player 'invades' neighboring territory and then must make a higher-scoring word than his or her opponent.

Source: Wikipedia, "Quarrel (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120344.description:
Run for Your Life! is free downloadable content for Cadwallon: City of Thieves that adds a new high-stakes timer to the game. Featuring new map tiles and locations along with the variant rules to use them, Run for Your Life! brings even more variety to nightly illicit activities. This variant requires The Inn, Cry Havoc!, and A Gamble in the Dark, which are each available via the links on each of the respective BGG pages, or on Fantasy Flight's support page.

Run for Your Life! introduces the amazing Seismic Scale of Mage-Geologist Von Riechter, which can accurately predict the total destruction of Cadwallon based on the increasing strength of tremors and aftershocks. Watch the scale closely; the thief brave enough to endure fire and falling rubble might just claim the most wealth, if he isn’t killed first.
120344.name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – Run for Your Life!

120345.name: Blockbuster
120345.description:
From the DOS Box Back

The concept is simple: you must destroy each brick before you an advance to the next level. Simple? It takes strategy and skill to shatter each new screen and move ahead. Collect special bonus tokens to earn sophisticated "brick-bashing" weaponry - and be sure to avoid the dive bombing aliens.

With more than 80 scenes to master and an option to create 48 more yourself, this is the blockbuster that takes up where the Arcade classic Breakout left off.

Features:
-Fast Arcade Action
-Exciting graphics and sound.
-80 levels to master; 48 more that you can create
-A choice of 9 different weapons.

videogame.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120346.name: Star Wars Galaxies: The Total Experience

videogamecompilation.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120346.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Star Wars Galaxies and the Jump to Lightspeed expansion.

videogame.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120347.name: Star Wars Galaxies: The Complete Online Adventures

videogamecompilation.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120347.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Star Wars Galaxies expansions.

videogame.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120348.name: Star Wars Galaxies: Starter Kit

videogamecompilation.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120348.description:
User Summary

Star Wars: Galaxies Starter Kit is a compilation of An Empire Divided and Jump to Lightspeed.

120349.name: The Agency of Anomalies: Cinderstone Orphanage
120349.description:
Save the souls of prodigy children and their caretaker who disappeared during the fire in The Agency of Anomalies: Cinderstone Orphanage! As an agent of the Agency of Anomalies, it’s up to you to find the phantoms and find out who started the deadly fire. Help the inhabitants of the orphanage use their extraordinary abilities to break the plans of the mystical brotherhood and escape! Search gorgeous Hidden Object scenes and solve a paranormal mystery!

Source: The Publisher Website.

videogame.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120350.name: Star Wars: The Best of PC

videogamecompilation.77676: Star Wars Galaxies: An Empire Divided

120350.description:
User Summary

A compilation of a several Star Wars PC games.

120351.name: The Agency of Anomalies: Mystic Hospital
120351.description:
Become a special agent and investigate a military hospital that hosted a variety of terrifying experiments in The Agency of Anomalies: Mystic Hospital! Discover the monstrosities that soldiers, doctors, and nurses have been transformed into, as you explore every single room of the hospital. Dive into this dark Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game and stop a dimensional vortex from destroying the world!

Source: The Publisher Website.

120353.name: Station Access Collection
120353.description:
User Summary

Station Access Collection is a collection of MMO games from Sony Online.

120355.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 12 - Oct 2005)
120355.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 12)

Contents:

Races of the Mists Part I - The Dwarfed By David “of the Fraternity” Gibson
Fear and Frostbites - Frostburn Supplement in Ravenloft By Mark Graydon
War of the Mace - A quick contest on the WotC boards
Evening by the Fire - An Unexpected Visitor By Andrew "alhoon" Pavlides
Grim Tales - The Wolf By Stephen “ScS” Sutton
Growls in the Night - A Collection of Creatures By Andrew "alhoon" Pavlides
Misty Divine - The Complete Divine in Ravenloft By Mark Graydon
The Black Opal Guild - A Sinister Guild of Necromancers By Andrew "alhoon" Pavlides

Registery of Monsters - Excerpts from the Registry By Stanton F. Fink
The Tower of Silana - An Original Adventure By Andrew "alhoon" Pavlide
Credits

120356.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 13)

Contents:

When Nightmares Wake - Original Fiction By Robert W. Elliott
Starlit Signs - The Zodiac of the Mists by David "Jester" Gibson, Jakob and Jasper
The Omen Watchers - Sidnar's stargazers by Jacopo "Jakob" Veronese
The Isle of Ravens - A Report to the Fraternity of Shadows By Nathan
Story of the Fallen Queen - Stars of Dark and Light Merge By Mistshadow
Children of the Night - Ermintrude By David Gibson aka Jester
The Umbra - Fathers of the Fraternity By Nathan of the Fratermity
Sorcery and Shadows - Complete Arcane for Ravenloft By Mark Graydon

The Curse of Maplegrove - A tale of terror from Gothic Earth By Blake Alexander
Bleakstone - City on the Edge of Darkness By Stephen “ScS” Sutton
Credits - Authors and Editors

120357.name: Slam 'n Jam '96 featuring Magic & Kareem
120357.description:
User Summary

Slam 'n Jam '96 featuring Magic & Kareem was a basketball game developed by Left Field Productions for the Sega Saturn and the Sony PlayStation. It is a follow-up to Slam 'n Jam '95, which had been released for 3DO the year before. In terms of gameplay and concept, the game is essentially a 5-on-5 NBA Jam.

120358.name: Continental Soccer Game
120358.description:
An action football (soccer) game.

You must assemble the game before you can start play. The board has four legs and is, in effect, a table. Insert a number of rods on each side. When assembled properly, the rod handles will freely rotate when you twist them. Along any rod there will be a number of football players.

When the ball is in play you can twist a player so that he 'kicks' the ball. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing at the same time so play becomes frenetic from the start. The onject is to kick the ball into your opponent's goal. The player who scores the most goals, wins.

These type of games are most often seen at gaming arcades in Britain and I guess the same applies to the States.

120359.name: Anduin (Issue 62 - Jul 2001)
120359.description: This issue contains the 2nd part of the DSA adventure "Insel der 1000 Schlangen" and the shadowrun adventure "Twist"

120360.description:
This debut Gargantuan product contains not only a black dragon, but extensive stats for the figure as well. There is also a full-color map and a playable game scenario, as all the figures in the D&D Icons line are playable in both the D&D Miniatures skirmish game and any roleplaying campaign.

Components:
One pre-painted Gargantuan black dragon (4”x4” base)
Double-sided stat card
Playable encounter
Full-color poster map
120360.name: D&D Icons: Gargantuan Black Dragon

120361.description:
Product Description
Unleash the horror of the Abyss! One of the most powerful demon lords of the Abyss, Orcus, Demon Prince of the Undead, sets out to destroy the world of the living and rule over the undead! Can your adventurers stand against this vile demon prince? Each box set contains one pre-painted, fully assembled, plastic Gargantuan Orcus figure, in scale with other Dungeons & Dragons miniatures, complete with a full-color game stat card.
120361.name: D&D Miniatures: Orcus , Prince of Undeath

120362.name: Assassin's Creed: Rearmed
120362.description:
Assassin's Creed: Multiplayer Rearmed is a multiplayer video game designed for iOS. It is the first and only Assassin's Creed Multiplayer driven by an in-game economy. The aim is to assassinate the assigned target and avoid being killed by your own hunter. The player can purchase additional items, characters and abilities as well as compete with friends and foes from around the globe in a 4 player realtime online multiplayer mode. Players can connect via Game Center using either WI-FI or 3G. It is also possible to play against someone in the immediate area via Bluetooth. Available map locations include Jerusalem, San Donato, Venice and Alhambra

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's Creed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120363.name: Ein neues Märchenspiel
120363.description:
Objective: be the first to reach target space 'E' (101)
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/moving by turn -
move your meeple according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside

120364.name: Beleman (Issue 2 - Nov 2004)
120364.description:
This issue contains the 4 ingame regional isues:


Havena Fanfare
Andergastische Freie Trommel
Nostrische Postille
Thorwal-Standarte


all with editiorial Gamemaster tricks and tips for regional scenarios and background infos.

120365.name: Der verrückte Kreisel
120365.description:
Objective: score most points spinning a top
- acting by turn -
each players spins a top inside the - with dents adored - box
the dent where the top ends shows the winning points you get

remarks:
several editions - first one ~ 1925
in comparison with other spinning-top-scoring-zone games the top docks in, not a marble, a pin...

120366.name: Ron, Ron, By a Ron bottle
120366.description:
user summary

1st playable adventure of Killer in Shadows, in which our Pj's have to discover all about a terrible leyend: the Tritón. A monster who kill sailors in a cruel revenge. Will they can survive?

120367.name: Protodimension (Issue 11 - Winter 2012)
120367.description:
From the publisher:

We are pleased to announce that Protodimension Magazine issue 11 is now available for your reading pleasure. This time around we have a clutch of new beasties for the BRP system, some modern-era characters and plot seeds for Call of Cthulhu, a Dark Conspiracy adventure involving weird experiments, some brand new fiction, some classic spooky fiction, and (at last!) a submission for GUMSHOE/Trail of Cthulhu.

120368.description: The vehicles supplement to The Great Rail Wars. There are rules for weird science gizmos, steam wagons, and ornithopters and some new scenarios.
120368.name: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – Derailed!

120369.name: H.G. Wells' War of the Worlds

rpg.2752: H.G. Wells' The War of the Worlds

120369.description: User Summary: Deep7's 1PG system game based on the famed story "War of the Worlds" by H.G. Wells

120370.description:
A simple track game designed and illustrated by Jessie MacQueen Mackintosh (1892–1958). In the game, Mackintosh used not only Aboriginal motifs, but also illustrations of traditional Aboriginal life and cultural events.

Being a roll and move game, there are plenty of special spaces and you must obey them if you end your move on one. Special spaces include No. 5 Dig for honey ants — miss a turn? No. 13 Throw boomerang — run to the emu space; No. 45 Pointing bone — you are knocked out of the game; No. 87 Lost churinga (shield), go back to No. 71’. And so on.

The explanatory notes that accompany the game are an attempt to broaden the knowledge of the players about indigenous culture.

I cannot be absolutely certain but it would appear the game was never boxed (highly plausible in the 40's after the war).
120370.name: Corroboree

120371.name: Halcyon Core Rulebook
120371.description:
User Summary:
A post-apocalyptic science fiction/fantasy game set in a near future New York City renamed Halcyon, full of both mundane and fantastic danger.

120372.name: Forgotten Archetypes 1: The Gunslinger
120372.description:
From publisher blurb:

Experienced D20 System author Patrick Younts introduces The Gunslinger, a 20-page PDF. The duelist, the greedy highwayman, the sniper whose deadly touch can bring down a victim from miles away, all these are examples of the gunslinger. Though some choose to romanticize the gunslinger's trade, and though some gunslingers act as champions of the people, using their guns in the defense of the helpless, in truth the gunslinger is nothing more and nothing less than a lightning fast, cold blooded killer, an artist of death who can look his opponents in the eye and snuff their life without blinking.

120373.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 19 - 1988)
120373.description: This issue contains the fantasy adventure "Das unheimliche Moor" and a new class for AD&D

120374.name: Free Arcane Spell Components
120374.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF presents nine original arcane spell components for use with 101 Arcane Spell Components. These components continue the numbering from 101 Arcane Spell Components and, for numbers 1-101, you will need that book.

120376.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 20 - 1989)
120376.description: This issue contains the fantasy adventure "Geisterhafte Kräfte"

120377.name: 13 Gene Therapy Templates
120377.description:
From publisher blurb:

Building on the gene therapy templates concept found in the future SRD, Future: 13 Gene Therapy Templates presents ten new gene therapy templates and reprints the four templates found in the future SRD.

Through the use of the gene therapy templates found in this PDF a GM can modify any existing NPC in order to create a genetically engineered navigator, a canine-meld, a tracker, or one of eleven other character types.

As with all templates, the gene therapy templates in this PDF and a quick-and-dirty way to instantly transform an existing stat block into something new with which to subject your players to danger. And with the GM's permission, any one of these gene therapy templates can be used to change a PC into something new and exciting.

120378.name: 13 Gravity Age Rumors
120378.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 10-page PDF presents 13 rumors for Gravity Age space opera/action-based campaigns. These rumors are written for use as background chatter or as adventure hooks that the GM can use to base entire adventures on. Several rumors make excellent short encounters that can be thrown into a larger plot.

120379.name: Heroes of the Dungeon Crawl Basic Charts Edition
120379.description:
Publisher's description:
The Heroes of The Dungeon Crawl Basic Charts Edition book has all of the basic game mechanics you need to start playing the game. Among the information included in these pages is Game Character creation information, Creature Charts, Treasure Charts and Combat Mechanics. Take your GC's from 0 Degree to 4th Degree, or further if you have a resourceful Hero Guide. Explore the depths of the two level dungeon included inside. All you need to start playing Heroes of the Dungeon Crawl is this book, some six sided dice and some paper. It's easy enough that most people can learn and be playing within minutes. So, what are you waiting for. Excitement and Adventure await. Are you brave enough to enter the dungeon?

120380.name: Monopoly: Freiburg
120380.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Freiburg, in Germany.

120381.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Gießen, in Germany.
120381.name: Monopoly: Gießen

120382.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 26 - 1990)
120382.description: This issue contains an adventure for Paranoia "Eine Unmöglichkeit" and the AD&D adventure "Mordrevan - Der Teufel im Innern"

120383.description:

120384.name: HeroQuest LARP Rules
120384.description:
website blurb
Like other LARP systems, Heroquest has its own rules that we've developed and playtested for over twenty years. We are currently in the process of updating the rules which have continued to evolve so that these pages are a little out of date

user comment
the rules are accessed from the website

120385.description:

120388.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 28 - 1990)
120388.description: This issue contains the AD&D adventure "Ein Wintermärchen"

120389.name: Monopoly: Hof
120389.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.
